name: Downtown Bozeman Vacation Rental
description:
Just four easy blocks from historic downtown Bozeman, this modern loft apartment is your perfect retreat. Enjoy a private loft, with modern amenities, just minutes from the best that Bozeman has to offer, shopping, fine dining, and nightlife.

Need a vehicle rental? I’m happy to share my friend’s Turo link after booking.

STR22-00028
host_about:
I'm a born and raised Montanan. I've done some traveling around the world and I just couldn't leave "The Last Best Place". I am a designer at A&E Design, a local Architecture and Design Firm. 

I live in the main house of the property with my black lab mix 'River'.  We spend a lot of our time outside on the river, slopes, hunting, camping, or hanging out in Historic Downtown Bozeman. 

We look forward to accommodating you and your adventure to this great town.

name: 2 Blocks 2 Main
description:
This space is designed for 1-2 people that want to sleep in the same bed. More details are below in the space section.

According to our local laws, I need to post my registration number and there is no place on this website to post it so decided to put it here - Registration #STR22-00083
neighborhood_overview:
I love that it is 2 blocks from the heart of downtown Bozeman where you will find a wonderful assortment of shops, restaurants, the city library, walking trails, and a park. A walking trail start just 1 block south that will take you by fields, wooded areas, creeks, and a duck pond. It is four blocks to the city library and one block to Bogert Park and the outdoor city pool. Being a native of this area, I will be able to help you match your preferences regarding restaurants, activities, etc. to the huge array of options.

Bozeman and the surrounding area has so much to offer: 1.5 hours to Yellowstone Park, unending hiking and cross country ski trails, two top notch downhill ski areas with a total of 24 lifts and 222 named runs, world class fishing, golfing, everything from amazing sushi to one of the best steaks you will ever eat, great little shops with unique items, amazing chocolates and caramels made locally, the best shoe store ever, majestic mountains all around a
host_about: I have lived in or near Bozeman all of my life.  I purchased this home several years ago and raised my three children here and now that they are off on their own adventures, I would love to share this home with you and all this amazing area has to offer.

name: Charming downtown home, Bogart park
description:
Location, location, location! This home is located 3 blocks from downtown and 100 yards from Bogart park. Located at the top of historic Lindley street, this neighborhood is the best location for all your downtown Bozeman shopping and eating.

Bozeman Hosting permit #313210
neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to downtown, Petes hill, Bogart park farmers market and ice rink. Both Koch and Lindley are not through streets making this quite but still in the heart of downtown. Wonderful neighbors with a true sense of community
host_about: I'm originally from Colorado and calling Bozeman Montana my home for the last 16 years.  My passions are skiing, fishing, camping, biking, live music and anything outdoors.  I am happy to share my home with respectful guest. The community here is amazing and I hope you get a taste of the quite, old bozeman.  I hope the location and space of my house serves as a home base for your time in Montana.

name: Sunny Bozeman MSU Cottage
description:
#STR23-00143

Our bright and open Mother-in-Law unit is newly remodeled and in a great location in Bozeman. You can walk or bike to downtown, MSU, neighborhood parks, trails, coffee shops and restaurants. Easy drive to Yellowstone Park and much more to explore.
neighborhood_overview: At the cottage you are a few blocks from MSU campus, Joe's Parkway Grocery, Pickle Barrel sandwiches AND Ice Cream shop, 2 coffee shops, and the AWESOME Columbo Pizza place. Neighborhood parks - Cooper Park and Southside Park- are also a few blocks away.
host_about:
I am a mother of 2 who enjoys to cook and play outside. I love my neighborhood and would not want to live anywhere else in Bozeman- and trust me I have looked but this is the place for me! 
Both my husband and I are from the East coast and travel back as often as possible. 
I love the warm season here and my husband loves the cold-you will get plenty of input from us if you need suggestions on what to do.

name: Lovely 2BR Bozeman Cottage near Main St
description:
Note: 30 day minimum rentals only.
Welcome to my quaint and comfortable two bedroom Bozeman cottage! Walking distance to Main Street - enjoy restaurants, parks, nearby skiing and rivers, and unwind with a drink on the deck.
neighborhood_overview: Great location! Only a few blocks walking distance to Main Street. I'd be happy to give you restaurant, bar and cafe recommendations. Bridger Bowl ski resort is 15 miles up the road, and Big Sky ski resort is about an hour away. Lots of hiking, biking and rivers to enjoy around Bozeman. The north entrance to Yellowstone National Park is around 1 1/2 hours away.
host_about: Avid cyclist, horse rider and skier. Favorite travel destinations: Costa Rica, Scandinavia, France, Italy, and the Rocky Mountains.

name: The Loft: near MSU, private entry, kitchen & baths
description: Our fun & sun-filled Loft has a private entrance, a  newly remodeled and well-stocked full kitchen, a bathroom with shower/tub, a queen & a twin bed, AC, a separate toilet area, a sofa/seating area & a TV with Prime/Netflix/Apple/Max - and an indoor swing! There is a Traeger BBQ & an outdoor dining table + two bikes, and a full washer/dryer & 2nd half bath in the garage. We have designated parking for Loft guests, and are just blocks from the university & historic downtown.    STR 22-00101
neighborhood_overview: The Southside of Bozeman is the main historic district. It is composed of safe, and friendly neighborhoods lined with mature trees, and an eclectic array of architecture. From our home, it is only a few minute walk to MSU, a short bike ride or walk to the historic downtown. And just two blocks from our home is Bozeman's Southside Park, with a play ground for kids, plus tennis/pickle ball courts, and in the winter,  an ice skating rink.
host_about:
We moved to Bozeman, Montana from Sonoma County in 2000 with a little kid, two dogs & a cat. The following decades were largely spent renovating this old 1920's home, while juggling all things young families juggle. Thankfully, things are finally slowing down.

Before joining AirBnB, we hosted international students and non-profit workers in "The Loft" - our  private entry guest space  - but have found hosting on AirBnB to be a great experience!

name: Yellow Dogs Cottage: Unique Large Downtown Cottage
description: Yellow Dogs Cottage is a Stylish and uniquely charming cottage is walking distance to Montana State University and town, close to skiing at Bridger Bowl & Big Sky, fishing, hiking, and so much more. Nestled in a lush, historic South-side neighborhood this cottage is thoughtfully and lovingly renovated and decorated. The cottage is always cleaned & sanitized between guests. One space flows into the next, making this a relaxing get-away spot.
neighborhood_overview:
Yellow Dogs Cottage
We think our neighborhood is the nicest in Bozeman. Here is where you will find most of the town's historic homes, including the Story Mansion just one block away. There is a wonderful, friendly atmosphere with a mix of locals, transplant families, and university students who all live in Bozeman for the amazing quality of life and accessibility to the incredible array of outdoor activities and beauty. MSU and downtown are each less than 10 minutes by foot. Hiking and biking trails are close by.
host_about:
I have had my home and cottage in Bozeman for over 20 years. During that time our family lived abroad in Lugano, Switzerland, and then Surrey, England for over 9 years, returning to our home once or twice a year to stay in touch with lovely Bozeman and our wonderful local friends. We are originally from Connecticut and have lots of family there that we visit regularly. I’ve been back in Bozeman full time for about 8 years and love all the many activities MT has to offer including skiing, snow shoeing, hiking, cycling, camping, tennis, pickleball, yoga  and so much more. 

I have two sons, one who graduated from the US Naval Academy Annapolis and is now a Marine Officer stationed at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina. The other graduated from University College London, England Medical School and is currently working as a doctor in London and is a competitive rower. 

I’m busy managing my rental properties located on the edge of the MSU campus and our lovely Yellow Dogs guest Cottage along with working as a Property Manager for others. 

Our Yellow Dogs are named Rumo & Tater.  You will occasionally see them playing and chasing balls in the fenced in backyard.

name: Your Private Suite 1 block from heart of Downtown
description:
Spacious Suite, PRIVATE building, sleeps 4, Walk to EVERYTHING downtown, FAST internet. Bozeman City license STR20-00361.
Larger than downtown hotel rooms with the same amenities. Convenient bike/ski/luggage storage. Off-Street Parking! High-speed 240 volt EV charger (NOTE! Window AC installed May 15 to September 1)
If you have ANY concerns about amenities or what is provided, contact us before booking. Welcome!
neighborhood_overview: The main house was built in 1880 and remodeled extensively in 2003.  Your suite was new construction in 2003.  Originally the site of one of Bozeman's blacksmith shops, the property is in the historic district just one block from Main street.  The location offers a perfect balance of proximity and privacy.  Just far enough off of Main for tranquility but only a minute or two walk to the heart of Downtown.  Go for breakfast at family oriented Overeasy or the hip Nova Cafe.  Or show up early for biscuits and gravy at the Western Cafe where ranchers, bankers and everyone in between have met over coffee for generations.
host_about:
In our 70's, my wife Linda are retired from 45 year-long careers in outdoor pursuits and adventure travel.  We have been hosting since 2016.  From 1975 to 2015 we pioneered educational and adventure travel to Baja California (whale watching, sea kayaking, natural history)  China, Tibet, Argentina, Mongolia, and Uruguay on horseback.    
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/6800497

We pay our cleaners more than $30 per hour.

name: Downtown Red Chair Retreat
description: With the reYour own private entrance with one bedroom, one sitting room with futon couch/bed and a bathroom.  Sitting room has smart TV, bluetooth stereo.  This 2nd floor dwelling has no kitchen facilities but is located in a quiet neighborhood only 2 blocks from restaurants, shopping and nightlife in downtown Bozeman.    Bonus entry area with fridge, coffee/tea maker, filtered water.  Plenty of stocked glasses, dishes and utensils for meals that do not require cooking. -STR23-00001
neighborhood_overview: This is a north side neighborhood which is clean and moderately quiet (being blocks from Main street downtown area).  This area is very desirable because of its location and has recently transformed into being the "hip" part of Bozeman.
host_about: I have been a resident of Bozeman for 40 years and former Director of Marketing and Reservations at Bridger Bowl for 28 years.  I'm also an avid Nordic skier, cyclist, fly fisherman, traveler and a musician. I've cuurently combined interest in Latin percussion and travels to Cuba to do a cross-cultural music project with musicians from Santiago de Cuba and Bozeman.  I've also served on Yellowstone Country of Montana regional tourism board for many years and know the area very well.  I love food ...and I know where to find the good stuff!

name: Heron's Nest
description: Welcome to your perfect Bozeman retreat! This loft-style apartment is situated in a fantastic neighborhood, just half a block from a beautiful 5-acre park, trail system, and trout-stocked pond. Positioned above a detached two-car garage, the unit offers privacy with no shared walls and vaulted ceilings that create an open and airy atmosphere.
neighborhood_overview: This lovely, established neighborhood has quick access to over 7 miles of walking trails.  A  block away lies a 5 acre park which offers a multitude of activities.  Walk or run the trail that circles the large pond stocked with blue ribbon trout (catch and release fishing allowed).  Enjoy a picnic in the shelter at the pond, complete with BBQ grills.  Set the kids loose in the popular playground and gather the friends and family for a sand volleyball match.  The Gallatin Valley 100 acre park is less than a mile away and the unit is minutes from downtown.  Keep the car parked and walk or bike to The Market, Bozeman's new hub of dining and shopping convenient for west side residents.
host_about:
I am a Montana native, born and raised in Bozeman. I love it here and I never get tired of the breath taking mountain views.  I have been managing my own real estate rentals for over 20 years and appraising real estate here in the Gallatin Valley since 2007.  I am also a real estate broker at Starner Commercial Real Estate in Bozeman Montana.

I like to travel to warm locations. My husband and I honeymooned in Thailand and I hope to visit again someday.   My hobbies include hiking, spending time with family and working on real estate deals.   I've enjoyed being an AirBnB host and all the great people I've met along the way!

name: Modern Farmhouse in Historic Downtown Bozeman
description:
Bright, modern, and tastefully appointed, this newly-built, gold-LEED house has it all. Cook in the light-flooded gourmet chef's kitchen; lounge in the beautiful backyard; enjoy your coffee on the back terrace or stroll to Main Street in just a few minutes.

Rest easy in this fully legal rental--we are registered with both Bozeman (Registration #17593) and Montana. With us your travel plans are 100% secure.
neighborhood_overview: This house is located in the South Black South Tracy Historic District. Walk across the street from the house and you access Linear Trail, an old railroad line converted to a trail and perfect for your morning run. Connect from there to Peets Hill for fabulous views of the entire Gallatin Valley. Also three minutes from the house is Bogert Park, with a big playground and weekly farmer's markets in the summer. And, a few more paces brings you to the Bozeman Library.
host_about:
We have lived in the Bozeman area over 20 years and envisioned this dream home, which we built in 2010, as a blend of local historical architecture and modern design trends. It is our once and future primary residence, but while we're living out of state much of the year, we are ready to share our home with you. 
Sincerely, Otto & Anne

name: Story Street Rental Apartment
description:
Lots of Privacy! Fenced in Courtyard and hidden deck amongst the trees will make your stay here memorable. This two story apartment boasts hardwood floors throughout, a fully stocked kitchen and a deep soaking tub in the bathroom. As a bonus, we are close to EVERYTHING!!! 3 Blocks to MSU and 8 to historic downtown Bozeman.

The free bus service with routes to Bridger Bowl and Big Sky ski areas is 2 blocks away!

name: Downtown Digs (3 blocks from the center of DT)
description:
Welcome to Bozeman MT where skiing, fishing, hiking, and Yellowstone National Park are at your fingertips. And if you are staying in Bozeman then why not stay steps from where all the buzz happens. Our 2 bedroom 1 bath apartment is located 3 blocks from the center of downtown. We are just steps away from restaurants, boutiques, coffee shops, theaters, and great nightlife. Want 2 KING BEDS? Just ask and we can push the twins together!
NEED MORE SPACE? ASK US ABOUT OUR HOUSE NEXT DOOR!
neighborhood_overview: When visiting Bozeman there really is no better place to stay then right in the heart of downtown. Your apartment is 3 blocks away to the center of the downtown. There are so many great restaurants, boutiques, art galleries, coffee shops, beauty, and nightlife right around the corner from your location on Main Street. Nine blocks the other way gives you access to the shuttle that will take you directly to the ski area at Bridger Bowl.  You will also find a big park located just a block away. Whether you are here for the skiing, hiking, fishing, or visit to Yellowstone you will find our location a great base area for all your fun!
host_about: Tommy and I are a young couple that both grew up in the area.  We enjoy traveling and meeting new people along the way.  When we aren't exploring the world we are in our hometown enjoying the scenery. Since we are both from the area we like to share where our favorite places to go and share our piece of paradise with the rest of the world. We a

name: Stroll to Meyers Lake, Airy Two Bedroom Guesthouse
description:
Sleep in soft, beautiful bed linens with pretty patterns. Wake to songbirds, mountain views, and the smell of locally roasted coffee. Generous windows let natural light into fresh spaces filled with timeless, elegant furnishings. Petrified bamboo floors, & granite and stainless steel appliances add a special touch. A gleaming kitchen and living room offer panoramic Montana mountain views. Walking paths are just 1/2 block away to Myers Lake.

STR-2200029: City Hosting Permit Number
neighborhood_overview: The guesthouse is in a quiet, family-friendly, residential neighborhood, a short stroll to restaurants, bars, coffee, and a great walking path. Go fishing, ice-skating, and bird-watching at Meyers Lake, just 2 blocks away. Hiking trails and skiing abound.
host_about:
We love cooking and eating good food (especially ethnic!), music (eclectic), wine, travel, art, and time spent outdoors. Designed for the more independent traveler - our style of hosting is more hands off, allowing guests to experience Bozeman on their own agenda. *We are, however; always available by call or text to answer any question guests may have! 

We can't live without our fly-rods, skis, tents/Rpod, travel, and our hiking shoes. Our 13 year old Golden Retriever keep us thoroughly entertained!

Adventure meets luxury is our travel style; both domestically and internationally. 

Our MO: if you remain open to life, then no matter how old you are chronologically, you are still young. Also, run your own race!

name: Downtown Urban Chic
description: This studio apartment is located 3 blocks north of historic downtown Bozeman. Private free parking, private patio with chiminea, separate entrance, lush flower gardens, nearby shopping, pubs, restaurants, Willson Theatre and community parks.  MSU is 1.5 miles from our home.
neighborhood_overview: This is in a neighborhood on the North side of downtown, eclectic and up and coming.  We also have a business license which ensures our guests that they can book with us and know it is secure and in accordance with our city provisions regarding Airbnb rentals.
host_about:
I moved to Bozeman over 30 years ago to attend college at MSU, and decided this was my home.  I am a Montessori teacher, my husband, Brian, is a lawyer and a native to Montana. We love the outdoors including; hiking, fishing, golfing and playing tennis.  
We love to travel, some of our most recent trips include; Australia, Italy, Belize, Turkey, Africa, Spain, Amsterdam and Switzerland. We love staying at other Airbnbs when we travel

name: Rustic-Contemporary Downtown
description: Enjoy the Bozeman vibe in the NEBO district on Fridley Street. This stylish and functional apartment was recently completed (not remodeled) to include high-end features such as radiant in-floor heat, reclaimed wood accents, task LED lighting, tiled shower, full kitchen appliance package, pantry, full-sized washer/dryer, storage for personal items, and more. Nearby is local linear trail, Wild Crumb, Bozeman Brewery, Mountains Walking, Fink's Deli, Treeline Coffee, Aleworks and much more.
neighborhood_overview: The NEBO district of Bozeman is a low-key, historic neighborhood with breweries, shops and fantastic places to eat nearby. There is also a trail system nearby that can be accessed to take you to the "M" mountain trail, Pete's Hill and Drinking Horse.
host_about:
Dear Host,
I work in the business of housing as a Montana real estate broker/partner at Bozeman Broker Real Estate.  When I vacation, my greatest thrill is exploring the towns, food and people that contribute to the vibe of that area. I have literally traveled the world and continue to, when time permits. I have two outstanding adult daughters and a travel partner of 30 years (also called my husband!).

name: Blue Willow Guest House
description: The Blue Willow Guest House is only 4 blocks from Historic Downtown Bozeman, so just a quick stroll to parks, music, bars, restaurants, galleries and great shopping. It is also close to MSU, the Museum and a short drive to Bridger Bowl Ski Resort!
neighborhood_overview: The Blue Willow was built in the late 1930's and many homes that surround it are of that era. It is a residential neighborhood with a great park and public pool 1 block away. Main street is 4 blocks away with great restaurants and retail shops. Trails to the mountains are a short walk away. Bridger Ski Resort is 16 miles away.
host_about: I am a Bozeman, Montana native who has returned to Bozeman after having big city adventures and realizing this is really " The Last Best Place." I own a retail business on Main Street just blocks away and I'm proud to share this special place with you! If you need anything during your stay or simply want recommendations, I'm available!

name: Charming Campus Home
description: Relax in the comfort of our charming 2-bedroom retreat, conveniently located blocks away from campus and the vibrant downtown of Bozeman. Whether you're gearing up for the mountains or eager to delve into local attractions such as the Museum of the Rockies, our home serves as the ideal launch pad for adventure. After a day of exploration, unwind in our cozy home, where comfort and convenience await. Every detail has been thoughtfully curated to ensure a comfortable stay. We’re happy to host you!
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman's south side historic district is charming. It is close to the university and also close to the abundance of restaurants and nightlife in downtown Bozeman, offering a variety of choices to please any palate. We'd be happy to share recommendations for our favorite spots!
host_about: I grew up in Bozeman after moving here as young child from Canada. I love to travel, meet people from all around the world, and get outside to play as much as life allows. My husband and I feel lucky to get to raise our kids in Bozeman, and to share the town we love with travelers who love exploring the world as much as we do!

name: Walk to Downtown! Historic Studio with Sun
description:
This charming second story studio sanctuary is full of light and warmth with picture windows, a breakfast nook, a lovely patio and outdoor grill just below. Comfortable queen bed ( as well as a good full airbed with a set of sheets if needed additionally). Great location! with easy access to downtown within a few blocks and immediate access to roads leading to wilderness, skiing and hiking. Treehouse in summer, cozy nest in winter.

License # 312682
neighborhood_overview:
A friendly neighborhood on a quiet street lined with mature trees just 5 blocks from historic downtown Bozeman. You will get a true taste of local life in our quaint and lively Big Sky town. The neighbors are friendly, down to earth, cooperative, and caring. We are just 5 minutes away from the Community Food Co-op in operation since 1971, a variety of coffee shops, bakeries, and restaurants, just another few blocks towards downtown. We also have easy access to outbound highways which will quickly take you to our beautiful mountains and rivers where you will find some of the world's best hiking, fly fishing and skiing in every direction. For the art enthusiast, we have a well established art community, the hub of which is located within easy walking distance at the Emerson Cultural Center. The Montana State University campus is a few minutes drive and a twenty minute walk south.

The larger neighborhood: The studio is centrally located to major ski areas such as Bridger Bowl
host_about: Hello, I am a fourth generation Montana Native, born in Bozeman. I am a visual artist/photographer and wilderness lover. My father was a fishing guide and renowned naturalist in this area so I can show you some out of the way places that won't appear in your guidebooks, as well as some of the tucked away local hangs. Montana is known for her friendly folks. We fit the bill here at the Colburn House.  Let us host you Montana style! Lively, friendly and spacious.

name: Garden Cottage
description: Free, fast WiFi for remote learning/working needs. Keyless self check-in.
neighborhood_overview: The northeast neighborhood of Bozeman is the artsy, alternative side of town. A short walk downtown opens up all the amenities there, and a few blocks away from downtown is one of Bozeman's favorite bakeries, Wild Crumb. There is a great new breakfast/lunch place just around the corner called UnKnotted. Great atmosphere and high quality offerings! MT Aleworks is 3 blocks away on Main St and has all the brewpub offerings and incredible burgers made with MT grassfed beef!
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Bridger guesthouse, 1/2 way between MSU/Downtown!
description:
This spacious 3 bed apartment is in an ideal Bozeman location. It is about a mile walk north to downtown, a mile walk west to MSU, a mile walk to the south lies the Museum of the Rockies, and a mile to the east on top of Peet's Hill in Burke Park.

Enjoy a home away from home, during your visit to Bozeman, at Bridger Guest House.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quintessential college town neighborhood, but boasts great access to the city trail system and nearby parks. Christie fields, Bogert Park, Lindley Park, Burke Park/Peet's Hill, and the Gallagator Linear Trail system are all very close. There are MANY small independent coffee shops/breweries/eateries within walking distance, and of course, the campus of MSU and downtown are about a mile away.

If you are a student, or family of a student, looking to check out the campus for MSU Fridays, or just whenever, let Mike know, as he is a graduate of the Microbiology program, and can fill you in. This may be the best neighborhood for college kids in town, as it is quieter, has amazing access to the town and its amenities, and sits in the middle of much of the downtown parklands.
host_about:
We are a family of four who live in Bozeman, MT. We met doing seasonal work in Yellowstone in 2004, and that was only the start of our ongoing adventure, which now includes two little girls.

We pride ourselves in knowing all of the secret spots in the surrounding Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem. We have an informative guidebook which can be useful when planning your adventures. It includes information about all manners of trips in the surrounding dozen different mountain ranges: hiking, mountaineering, rock climbing, whitewater rafting, caving,  skiing/snowboarding/Xcountry, fishing, boating/rafting, horseback riding, large animal and bird spotting, and much more. We also offer up an up to date city guide with ideas on what to do in or awesome town in between trips into the wilderness.

We are a young outdoorsy couple with a lot of travel experience, mostly in the big empty lands of our world. We are open to all types of people, whether young, old, LGBT, religious/athiest, brown, white, yellow, pink, or purple.

description: Located downtown Bozeman Montana at 107 South Church St next to The Bowl.  Walking distance to downtown restaurants, bars, shops, parks, hiking, and entertainment.  A safe quit place in the heart of Bozeman.

name: Best Location in Downtown Bozeman
description:
Best location in Bozeman!
Downtown Bozeman's Main Street, restaurants, shopping, local trails & parks, Sweet Pea Festival, Farmer's Market, swimming pool, library, and local grocery are all within walking distance!
You’ll love this gorgeous remodel of our 1890s farmhouse because of the prime location & quiet neighborhood.
Our place is great for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).
Please note small apt upstairs with a separate entrance & very quiet tenant.
neighborhood_overview:
This historic Bozeman home is located just one block off of historic East Main street in Bozeman, making it the perfect location to explore downtown Bozeman and the Main Street to the Mountains trail system. Prepare to park your car and enjoy this walking neighborhood :-)
This is generally a quiet neighborhood. You can expect occasional noise typical of a downtown neighborhood (sirens, motorcycle engines, and late night "bar hoppers"), and at certain times of year (Sweet Pea Festival, parades, running events, etc.) you may find yourself very near the "center of things".

description: My place is close to Main Street, MSU, hiking, fishing, mountain biking, centrally located, hour from two entrances to Yellowstone National Park, 20 miles from Bridger Mountain Skiing, Big Sky, Moonlight Basin, restaurants and dining, family-friendly activities, nightlife, public transport. You’ll love my place because of the coziness, the location, cleanliness. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is located in the newly deemed Midtown Bozeman. We are centrally located with walking distance to shopping and Main Street festivities is less than a mile away. This end of the street is part business district and residential.
host_about:
Outdoor adventurer, mother of two, wife to the best man ever. 
5 things I cannot live without are:
1. My running/hiking shoes
2. Coffee
3. Mountains
4. Bikes!

description:
Beautiful condo in Bozeman Montana, close to skiing, fly fishing, Montana State, Yellowstone, and the many other attractions found in and around scenic Bozeman. Voted one of outdoor magazines best towns in the country and powder magazines best ski town in the country. Why stay in a hotel when you can have a whole condo with all the amenities. *A $100 Fee will be charged for pets in addition to normal pricing.

City of Bozeman STR#-STR23-00011
neighborhood_overview: Condo development in west Bozeman with playground on site.

name: Great Room & Location with Private Bath & Balcony
description: Greetings! We've upgraded the space and added a door at the top landing for additional privacy for our long-term guests.  Stay within walking distance to MSU, Museum of the Rockies, Coffee, Restaurants, a 24-hour gym, and ice cream by the scoop! You’ll love this home because of the tree-house/ski chalet feel and the views to the hills from your own large balcony.  Trails are close by, bikes are available for use, and there is plenty of parking in the neighborhood.
neighborhood_overview: I love our Bozeman Creek neighborhood! We have a nice little spring creek that runs right next to our place. We have great neighbors, plenty of parking, a nice view of Pete's hill, trails, and a park nearby - all in a very quiet pocket of town in a sweet location.
host_about: Greetings!  I choose Montana as my home when I was 6 years old, after seeing pictures of Glacier National Park.  Nutley, New Jersey is a great place to be from, and Bozeman, Montana has been a wonderful place to live for the last 34 years.  Outdoor adventure, dancing, dinosaurs under the microscope, and ice skating fill my days.  You will find plenty of books on science and spirituality in our cool and cozy home - as well as an indoor slack-line!

name: Carriage House Cutie! (KING BED) -Steps From Lake
description:
Furnished with all new furnishings, our second level carriage house is available for a memorable vacation getaway!
It's quiet and tranquil setting allows you to relax and unwind after a day of exploring, and its many COMFORTS do not disappoint.
neighborhood_overview: Our quaint but modern apartment is "conveniently" located in the award winning Valley West neighborhood.  It is located close to many of Bozeman's attractions. In addition,  It is only 10 miles from the Bozeman Yellowstone International airport.
host_about:
Greetings!  
We are Jason and Celeste Lovelace.  We have been married 25 adventurous years and can't wait for 25 more!!  We moved to Bozeman Mt. 16 years ago from Seattle Washington and even though we love the Pacific Northwest, Bozeman has become home to us.  We feel very blessed to raise our  three children in this family-friendly community.  We own a painting company, and we are involved in real estate investing. We love to travel when time permits and hope to visit many vacation rentals in the future!

name: Cabin On Montana: Clean 3-bedroom 2-bath home
description: The Cabin On Montana offers guests a quiet comfortable place to stay while visiting beautiful Bozeman, Montana. The cabin was fully renovated in the summer and fall of 2016. It is well adorned with new mattresses, furniture, and appliances. The cabin is well situated with quick access to Bridger Bowl and other highlights in the area. It is a short walk or bike to the center of downtown or one of Bozeman's many breweries or restaurants.
neighborhood_overview: The Cabin On Montana is located in a residential neighborhood seven blocks north of downtown.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

name: Bozeman - Modern/Rustic 1 bedroom w/ Loft bedroom
description: My place is close (7 minutes) to nightlife, the airport, parks, and the city center. It is 15 minutes to skiing at Bridger Bowl. You’ll love my place because of the kitchen, the coziness, the high ceilings, the views, and the location. The location is extremely private at the end of the road yet 5 minutes to town. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. The loft area has mountain views out all windows. Custom mattresses, assortment of pillows.
neighborhood_overview: To get downtown you really only need to take 2 turns.  I think this location offers you the best of what Bozeman has to offer.
host_about:
I am a Washington State Native with a degree in Economics from University of San Diego. I am a licensed Realtor with Knoff Group Real Estate and I love searching for the perfect property for buyers.  I like to hike, bike, ski and adventure.  Please let me know if you need help finding real estate in one of the last best places. 

I want to make your stay as pleasant as possible so let me know if you need anything.

name: "Elegant Escape" (KING BED) Great Location!
description:
Come enjoy all that Bozeman has to offer in your home-away-from-home.
Relax and unwind in our sparkly clean, and very comfortable Bozeman escape!
Conveniently located to all of Bozeman's hot spots.
FYI- Cleaning fee $225 combined w/ $45 damage fee.
neighborhood_overview: This cozy retreat is "conveniently" located in a family friendly neighborhood steps from a playground, park, and walking trails. Four groceries, a fish market, banks, gas stations, and the Gallatin Valley Mall are all within a short bike ride or up to a five-minute drive, as well as a ten minute drive to downtown Bozeman.
host_about:
Greetings!  
We are Jason and Celeste Lovelace.  We have been married 25 adventurous years and can't wait for 25 more!!  We moved to Bozeman Mt. 16 years ago from Seattle Washington and even though we love the Pacific Northwest, Bozeman has become home to us.  We feel very blessed to raise our  three children in this family-friendly community.  We own a painting company, and we are involved in real estate investing. We love to travel when time permits and hope to visit many vacation rentals in the future!

name: 2 Blocks 2 Main with a View
description:
I have lived in or near Bozeman all of my life. I purchased this 100 year old home 30 years ago and raised my three children here and now that they are off on their own adventures, I would love to share this home with you and all this amazing area has to offer.

According to our local laws, I need to post my registration number and there is no place on this website to post it so decided to put it here - Registration #STR22-00083
neighborhood_overview: Wonderful neighborhood with many historic homes that are well maintained.  Walking trail starts a block from this apartment and goes through wooded areas with a creek and areas that have historic homes.
host_about: I have lived in or near Bozeman all of my life.  I purchased this home several years ago and raised my three children here and now that they are off on their own adventures, I would love to share this home with you and all this amazing area has to offer.

name: Bridger Creek Luxury home near Bridger Bowl Skiing
description:
This luxury Legends Chalet located in the Bridger Creek neighborhood in Bozeman is a well-appointed 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom home. The home is surrounded by trails for hiking, biking or taking a stroll with friends and family. Within blocks of the home you will find the Bridger Creek Golf Course, and just a short drive through the canyon will land you at Bridger Bowl, where you can "ski the cold smoke."

The home is very cozy with an open floor plan and high ceilings.
host_about: Stay Montana is a locally owned and operated Vacation Rental Company with locations in Big Sky, Bozeman and Flathead Valley. We know how valuable quality time with friends and family is and  the importance of creating memories that last a lifetime. Our Guest Services Team is happy to help you plan an amazing trip! From Yellowstone National Park to Glacier National Park and beautiful spots in between, we would love to assist with your planning!

name: Modern Studio - Rooftop Deck - STR23-00021
description: Our comfortable, newly constructed studio apartment offers privacy and is steps from a lake with a pavilion, walking trails, park, and playground. The large rooftop deck is ideal for a private morning breakfast or taking in evening mountain top views. Located in a desirable, charming neighborhood, the studio (carriage house) is perfect for the traveler seeking adventure (skiing, fishing, biking, hiking) or business in Bozeman and it's surrounding areas.
neighborhood_overview:
Our loft studio is conveniently located near most of what Bozeman has to offer including restaurants, grocery, parks, trails, MSU, and the downtown area. Guests planning trips to Yellowstone or Big Sky will appreciate the studio's convenient proximity to the entrance of Gallatin canyon.

Distance to the Airport is 15 min, Bridger bowl 30 min, Big Sky 50 min, Livingston 40 min, and West Yellowstone is 1.5 hrs.
host_about: We enjoy adventure, simplicity, good food, organic gardening, music, snow, rivers, and bicycles. We have two beautiful daughters, Parker and Sloan.

name: Welcome to Madison Guest House!
description: With 3 beds and 1 bath, and 2 outdoor spaces, in roughly 900 sq ft, the home is a welcome respite from the road, or plane! The home has wifi, full laundry/bath/and kitchen and 2 off street parking spots.
neighborhood_overview:
If we are full during your trip, check out our other listings:
-Exact floor plan and location with larger yard? Bridger Guest house may be open as well.

Our guest homes are located in University Subdivision, and tucked behind the Gallagator Trail on Bozeman's south side. Our neighborhood is located very close to 5 large municipal parks.

Bozeman Public Library / Lindley Park / Peet's Hill area just south of Main St. is a great family walk after a night enjoying the Downtown bars and restaurants.

To the west and south west, is Montana State University, and is a few minutes away by bike or walk. Enjoy football games, Museum of the Rockies, graduations, move-in/outs, and do some research and stay with us!
host_about:
We are a family of four who live in Bozeman, MT. We met doing seasonal work in Yellowstone in 2004, and that was only the start of our ongoing adventure, which now includes two little girls.

We pride ourselves in knowing all of the secret spots in the surrounding Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem. We have an informative guidebook which can be useful when planning your adventures. It includes information about all manners of trips in the surrounding dozen different mountain ranges: hiking, mountaineering, rock climbing, whitewater rafting, caving,  skiing/snowboarding/Xcountry, fishing, boating/rafting, horseback riding, large animal and bird spotting, and much more. We also offer up an up to date city guide with ideas on what to do in or awesome town in between trips into the wilderness.

We are a young outdoorsy couple with a lot of travel experience, mostly in the big empty lands of our world. We are open to all types of people, whether young, old, LGBT, religious/athiest, brown, white, yellow, pink, or purple.

name: Black Bear Inn: A comfy cozy 2 bedroom 1 bath unit
description: This is a beautiful native American inspired decorated  space. Private view looking out at the Bridger mountains! Peaceful and quiet, play bocci ball, badminton or corn hole  in backyard.   Home is cool all summer. We are within walking distance of the Cherry river fishing access and Bozeman beach.. We are a minute from town but secluded enough to feel like the country. A birders paradise. Close to Hot springs ! Awesome
neighborhood_overview: This is a secluded private country place , but on the edge of town and close to everything. It is a birders paradise being a flight path to the cherry creek ponds at the end of the road. While secluded we do have neighbors, although not visible. We ask that there are no loud parties.Fun and noise are fine just nothing over the top past 11 pm. And no fireworks .
host_about: I'm a happy go lucky host that can visit if you wish or give you privacy at the same time. I'm always happy to meet new people and give them a homey comfortable eclectic experience.

name: The Cottage Downtown
description:
Ditch hotels, travel like a local!
Expect more value for your dollar than a hotel. Here you will be able to save money cooking your own meals, sleep in separate rooms if you are a big group, wash your laundry, and enjoy Bozeman as if you lived here!
We are a family and this is a house. We are not a hotel chain. Please do not expect hospital corners on the bedsheets but expect clean linens and a tidy house.
Thanks for checking out The Cottage! Enjoy your stay!
neighborhood_overview: This is a quiet, family friendly, residential neighborhood located close to downtown and everything Bozeman has to offer!

This shared basement apartment offers you a private room while sharing the kitchen, bathroom, and living room with two other private rooms.

Early check-in available & a no-chore checkout!!

name: Your Adventure and Downtown Base-Camp
description:
*No cleaning fee!*

**Note: To minimize health concerns for everyone, common areas of the home are now off-limits to guests.

We have a cozy home conveniently located less than 30 minutes from Bridger Bowl and less than 5 minutes from shopping and dining. Downtown is a very short drive or bike ride away! The neighborhood is quiet and pleasant. You will get your own private room and full bathroom upstairs tucked away from the rest of the home.
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in a very quiet family oriented neighborhood tucked away from all the main roads. We’re within walking distance to 3 grocery stores, Cold Stone, the Barmuda triangle with 3 different bars and frequent food trucks off Main street and shopping on 19th ave. We’re also a 5min drive (or a 35 minute walk) to downtown Bozeman. We’re also a short drive to the university. It’s really easy to get pretty much anywhere in Bozeman, and we’re near all the main roads that access the interstate, Bridger Canyon, Hyalite and more.
host_about:
I like to learn more about the places I am visiting! I like history, nature, wildlife. When I visit a new place I love to try the local cuisine, learn the local history, walk or hike and try new activities. 

I have been to almost every state in the lower 48 along with several other countries. I enjoy outdoor sports, offroading, photography and learning more about human and natural history through National Parks and Monuments, museums, etc.

name: Bozeman Creek Loft
description:
Modern loft on the southside of Bozeman. Great views and open space full of wildlife.

Close to downtown, MSU and the Bobcat stadium. Walk or bike downtown on Bozeman's great network of trails or hike up the hill to enjoy a beautiful Montana sunset.

The apartment is on top of the garage and has a separate entrance. One bedroom with king bed, upper loft with two twin beds, full kitchen, bath, living/dining area and laundry. Everything you need for your stay!

License #: STR20-00368
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quiet neighborhood. There is a great park across the street and easy access to the Gallagator Trail which leads to Downtown, Bogart Park, Museum of the Rockies, library and the rest of the trail system. Langhor trail has a climbing boulder. Peet's Hill/Burke park is a short walk across the creek and up the hill. MSU is a short walk away.

Bridger Bowl ski area is about a 30 minute drive away and Big Sky Resort is a little over an hour. Yellowstone National Park is about an hour and 40 minutes.

name: *Downtown Luxury + Outdoor Patio*~ Walk Everywhere
description:
Enjoy modern sophistication in this elegant condo just one block from Main Street in Downtown Bozeman and all it has to offer. From stellar eateries and shopping to all outdoor activities, there is something for everyone! Our goal is to provide you with an unforgettable living experience while on vacation. We offer the perfect place to call home during your stay at Loft503, located at the intersection of Mendenhall & Church Ave in the heart of Historic Downtown Bozeman.
STR23-00004
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman is referred to as one of the “most livable places” for good reason! It is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter what time of year it is. Located in the heart of Downtown Bozeman, VRBozeman's properties offer something for everyone. In the warmer months you can explore the mountains, fly fish on world renowned rivers and streams, mountain bike on miles of trails and enjoy several other outdoor activities. In the winter you are 45 minutes from the largest ski resort in America, Big Sky and 15 minutes from the local hill Bridger Bowl. There is Nordic skiing, snow shoeing, ice climbing, hunting, snowmobiling and much more. If you need a break from the outdoors don’t fret. Bozeman has amazing eateries, shops, nightlife and offers a rich arts and cultural experience with a number of galleries, museums and historical points of interest. This area is perfect for a family getaway, a romantic vacation, or even a solo trip. Come and explore all tha

Room in a brand-new, modern eco house in probably THE BEST location in Bozeman.

host_about:
Greetings!  
We are Jason and Celeste Lovelace.  We have been married 25 adventurous years and can't wait for 25 more!!  We moved to Bozeman Mt. 16 years ago from Seattle Washington and even though we love the Pacific Northwest, Bozeman has become home to us.  We feel very blessed to raise our  three children in this family-friendly community.  We own a painting company, and we are involved in real estate investing. We love to travel when time permits and hope to visit many vacation rentals in the future!

name: Townhome w/ Fast & New WiFi - Walk to Downtown!
description: Explore the quaint town of Bozeman when you stay at this well-appointed 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom vacation rental townhome! This mid-century modern getaway offers all the comforts of home, incredibly fast internet connection, contemporary furnishings, and accommodations for 4. With its historic architecture packing tons of old time charm, an amazing location in the residential Bon Ton District, and several outdoor activities within minutes, this townhome is the ideal Montana retreat!
neighborhood_overview:
The city of Bozeman is scattered with various hidden gems, such as the American Computer Museum or Emerson Cultural Center. More well known is the Museum of the Rockies that has a research center, planetarium shows, and extensive collection of dinosaur fossils from around the world!

To explore downtown, take a leisurely 1-mile walk to North Wilson Avenue and find a variety of shops and restaurants! Coffee aficionados will love being close to so many brew houses, including The Nova Cafe, Zocalo Coffee House, and Wild Joe*s Coffee Spot.

No matter the time of year, there's always an outdoor activity to enjoy nearby, from hiking at Yellowstone National Park to skiing at Bridger Bowl when the snow falls. In the summertime, be sure to check out the serene beauty of Palisade Falls, the Gallatin River, and Grotto Falls Trail! Only 3 blocks away is The Gallagator Trail, also known as the Linear Trail, that extends from the mountains to downtown!

Close to

Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

name: Dahlia House
description: Sustainable super-insulated home with solar electricity and electric car charger! Free, fast WiFi for remote learning/working needs. Keyless self check-in.
neighborhood_overview: North Church Ave is the widest street in the northeast side as the trolley used to run up it. It also is bordered by two through streets so has much less traffic. There is an elementary school on the next block towards Main St with a house and an old church in between. It's a coveted residential area all the streets in the area have been totally redone so there are no major road closures during the summer which are common around town.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Red Chair Townhouse
description: Located in a quiet neighborhood only 3 blocks from Downtown Bozeman, this town house encompasses the front portion of the main house.  This is a very unique property with  private living quarters (owner occupied) on the backside of the main house which is attached to the living space above the garage.  There is also a separate Airbnb apartment (no kitchen) upstairs with its own private entrance, called the RedChair Retreat.   These spaces are separate and private. - STR23-00001
neighborhood_overview: Considering we're only a few blocks from downtown, we have a nice, quiet and predominately family neighborhood.  However, you're only a 5 minute walk from tons of restaurants, shops and nightlife.
host_about: I have been a resident of Bozeman for 40 years and former Director of Marketing and Reservations at Bridger Bowl for 28 years.  I'm also an avid Nordic skier, cyclist, fly fisherman, traveler and a musician. I've cuurently combined interest in Latin percussion and travels to Cuba to do a cross-cultural music project with musicians from Santiago de Cuba and Bozeman.  I've also served on Yellowstone Country of Montana regional tourism board for many years and know the area very well.  I love food ...and I know where to find the good stuff!

This spacious townhome was designed with you in mind!
We fashioned this home with many added comforts for a memorable vacation getaway.
Come relax and unwind in our cozy Bozone Bliss!

neighborhood_overview: This cozy retreat is "conveniently" located in a family friendly and "award winning Valley West" neighborhood steps from a playground, park, small lake, and walking trails. Four groceries, a fish market, banks, gas stations, and the Gallatin Valley Mall are all within a short bike ride or up to a five-minute drive, as well as a ten minute drive to downtown Bozeman.
host_about:
Greetings!  
We are Jason and Celeste Lovelace.  We have been married 25 adventurous years and can't wait for 25 more!!  We moved to Bozeman Mt. 16 years ago from Seattle Washington and even though we love the Pacific Northwest, Bozeman has become home to us.  We feel very blessed to raise our  three children in this family-friendly community.  We own a painting company, and we are involved in real estate investing. We love to travel when time permits and hope to visit many vacation rentals in the future!

name: Chickadee's Nest
description: Welcome to your bright and airy retreat in Bozeman! This newly renovated studio apartment, updated in the fall of 2018, offers modern comfort and efficiency in a prime location. Just a 3-minute drive or a 10-minute walk from Montana State University, it is perfect for visitors seeking convenience and style.
neighborhood_overview: Nestled between the Montana State University campus and the greater downtown area,  this property creates a home base just blocks from both.   Little to no "through traffic" as the house sits on a dead end street in a quiet residential neighborhood.  Within walking distance to coffee shops and restaurants.  You haven't taken in historic MSU Bozeman until dining at Columbo's pizza and the original Pickle Barrel on the MSU campus, both a 10 minute walk. A beautiful 1 mile stroll through the historic residential district of Bozeman brings you to downtown Bozeman before you know it,  traversing the trails in beautiful Cooper Park along the way.
host_about:
I am a Montana native, born and raised in Bozeman. I love it here and I never get tired of the breath taking mountain views.  I have been managing my own real estate rentals for over 20 years and appraising real estate here in the Gallatin Valley since 2007.  I am also a real estate broker at Starner Commercial Real Estate in Bozeman Montana.

I like to travel to warm locations. My husband and I honeymooned in Thailand and I hope to visit again someday.   My hobbies include hiking, spending time with family and working on real estate deals.   I've enjoyed being an AirBnB host and all the great people I've met along the way!

name: Big Sky Bozeman 2 BR Suite, Perfect for Kids/Pets
description: Our spacious 2BR suite in always-popular Bozeman might just be the Big Sky experience you’ve been searching for! We’re kid and pet-friendly and hope you bring them along to enjoy the gorgeous mountain and golf course views. We think we’re in the perfect location, with ski-in/ski-out, golf-in/golf-out, and fish-in/fish-out just minutes or even seconds from our door. We’re also just 5 minutes from downtown Bozeman for shopping, & dining 15 mins from the closest ski resort. STR20-00319
neighborhood_overview:
You’ll never lack for things to do while visiting Bozeman! In the heart of Big Sky country, Bozeman offers nearly endless activities, attractions, restaurants, shopping, and outdoor adventures. Here are just a few of our favorites.

Outdoor Activities & Attractions

Palisade Falls
Bridger Bowl Ski Area
Montana Grizzly Encounter
Gallatin River
Yellowstone Safari Company
Montana Angler Fly Fishing
Crosscut Mountain Sport Center
Big Sky Resort on Andesite Mountain
Madison River Tubing
Montana Alpine Guides

Museums

Museum of the Rockies
American Computer and Robotics Museum
Gallatin History Museum
Bozeman Sculpture Park

Cultural Activities

Bozeman Symphony
The Ellen Theater

Shopping

Gallatin Valley Mall
Downtown Bozeman, Mainstreet

And of course, what’s vacation without trying some new restaurants? We hope you’ll lose these
host_about:
Hello, my name is Erik and my lovely wife and cohost is Pepper. We originally built our 1200 sq. ft. addition for our family to come visit us but as they aged and with covid, it got too hard for them to visit. So we decided to start sharing it with guests from all over the world and it has been a wonderful experience. We truly love meeting our wonderful guests and getting to know them. 

Like so many other hosts, our family of 5 (plus Timber, our 1.5-year-old Chocolate Lab) loves to travel and we have been fortunate to see many places around the world.  Living in Montana has given all of us a deep appreciation of the natural world and its infinite activities. We all enjoy hiking, camping, rock climbing, and skiing. We have hiked all over Yellowstone and throughout the Gallatin mountains. 

In the springtime, I fly fish almost nightly in the two rivers behind our home on the other side of the Bridger Creek Golf Course.

When we’re not ticking off the boxes on our family bucket list, I am a Customer Service Representative for Delta and United Airlines and Pepper is a Pediatrician at Bozeman Deaconess Hospital.

We can’t wait to meet you!

name: Master Bedroom Suite onTrail System accommodates 1
description:
A beautiful well appointed guest room accommodations for ONE guest, a queen sized bed with attached master bathroom, including a large bathtub for relaxing soaks. The light is beautiful, pretty views full of seasonal flowers and Mountain views.

Our house is set on a quiet street, abutting trails and lush mountain views. Set in a lovely quiet neighborhood not far from Main St but away from the noise of downtown.

We welcome single travelers.
We have a small older dog that guests love.
neighborhood_overview:
Beautiful backyard trails with gorgeous views of Mt. Ellis for walking, running, xc skiing, mountain biking, with trails connecting to downtown. Views of the Bridger’s is a minute down the trail behind the house.

Walking downtown takes about 15 min. Give or take depending on your pace.

Security deposit required for stays longer than 10 nights.
host_about:
I’ve been enjoying the MAGICAL 
outdoors from the mountains to the ocean all of my life. 

Bozeman usually has beautiful weather, with too many summer activities to list from biking hiking kitesurfing you name it!…winter skiing both downhill + xc are some of the best in the world. The fishing is phenomenal, the people amazingly friendly + the town of Bozeman has so much to offer..Come play in the outdoors!  Happy to make some great suggestions!

Cozy loft filled with natural light, modern design, and incredible views. 15-minute drive to Bridger Bowl Ski Resort and 2-minute walk to Lindley Park with biking/hiking/groomed XC ski trails.

We are walking distance to brew pubs, restaurants, parks, trails and a newly opened grocery store.

description:
This is a lovely little standalone studio on Bozeman's Northside. Built in 2004, this studio is clean, tidy, and in great condition.

Located on Wallace Ave and within a few blocks of downtown, it's midway between Wild Crumb and Montana Ale Works.

This is a medium-term rental, with a minimum 30-day stay required. Longterm discounts are negotiable.

neighborhood_overview: This is a quiet old neighborhood of mostly single-family homes. It's a three-block walk to downtown Bozeman.
host_about:
Amy is the Development Program Manager for The Nature Conservancy in Montana. She has also worked as an expedition leader for the eco-tourism company Orbridge, hosting travelers across the western US and on the rivers of Western Europe. 

Amy's husband Chris is the founder of Habitat X, director of the Montana Weatherization Training Center, and an author in the sustainable housing industry.

Amy and Chris live in Bozeman, Montana.

name: West Olive Cottage
description: Free, fast Wi-Fi for remote learning/working needs. Keyless self check-in.
neighborhood_overview: Great neighborhood that's close to most attractions including MSU, downtown, airport.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Spacious One Bedroom Apartment with Laundry
description: Enjoy all the benefits of home in our comfortable and clean private apartment. Located centrally between Big Sky and Bridger Bowl Ski Areas and situated in the quiet and beautiful neighborhood, Valley West. A quick walk or bike ride will get you to nearby eateries. Just steps out the door are walking and biking trails around a lake.  Air conditioning and eight large windows will keep you comfortable after a day on the trails and radiant floor heat will keep you warm and cozy after the slopes.
neighborhood_overview:
We are located on the west end of Bozeman, near the entrance to Gallitan Canyon. Our street, Alexander, is one block off of Babcock St. A five minute walk to the south will get you to the Market at Ferguson Farms. This a development that has restaurants like, Sidewinders, Tanglewood, Nordic Brew Works and Hachi Sushi Pub. Foxtrot Cafe is located in the middle of the market and it anchors all these stores with an open air feeling and tons of lounge seating and tables. There are also a few boutiques, a reptile store and a grocery store being built as of summer 2023. We also love the Well Juicery, a cold pressed organic juice bar if you’re feeling healthy, or a really nice liquor store and cozy bar called Single Barrel if you’re feeling more spicy!
45 minute drive to Big Sky Resort, 1.5 hours to both the West and North entrance to Yellowstone National Park. Bridger Bowl, 30 minutes.
A quick drive over the pass to Livingston will get you to hotsprings, we love Chico Hotsprings

name: Haven in Bozeman- Close to MSU, Main St, Trails
description: Remodeled end unit condo, top/2nd floor close to everything!  Located steps from the Galagator/Main St  to Mountains walking/biking trail, the condo has modern updates, furnishings and a deck overlooking a creek.  Loads of natural light and very well appointed. There’s a smart tv in the living room and a Chromecast in the master to stream.  Strong WiFi. 10/30 min bike/walk to downtown (1.25 mi), 5 min walk to MSU & Museum of the Rockies. Cafe, restaurants and fitness studios across the street.
neighborhood_overview: Bike or walk (10/30 min, respectively) along  the beautiful Galligator trail to Main St. Across the street find restaurants , exercise studios, campus and Museum of the Rockies. Loads of hiking/mountain biking, dog friendly parks and trails in the immediate area. Driving distance to downtown is approx 1.25 mi and takes approx 4-5 minutes down historic and charming Willson Ave.  Big Sky Resort, Bridger Bowl and Yellowstone are all within easy driving distance for day trips.
host_about: Traveler, Athlete and current Food Truck owner... living a constant adventure!

name: Bridger View Bunkhouse
description: This brand new apartment in the new sought after area of Bozeman that has spectacular views of the Bridger Mountains and Spanish Peaks. This is the perfect jumping off point for all your Bozeman adventures.  The apartment comes fully furnished with every amenity you want for your stay!
neighborhood_overview:
This property sits in the heart of walking trails, biking trails, dog parks, and adventure! This is the perfect basecamp for getting out and seeing all that Bozeman and Montana has to offer. Whether you're here to see Yellowstone, fly fish our famous rivers, ski Bridger Bowl and Big Sky, Mountain Bike up at Hyalite, or just simply enjoying beautiful Bozeman, this is a perfect, safe, kid friendly area!
Ideally located to get to Bridger Bowl within 20 minutes as it is only 19 miles! Big Sky is less than 45 minutes away as it is only 44 miles from our place! The perfect spot for your Skiing and winter vacation!

name: SoBo Cottage. Easy Downtown Living.
description:
This beautifully renovated 1910 downtown home is the perfect spot for your Montana visit, adventure or staycation.

SoBo Cottage: #STR20-00293

Enjoy a spacious chefs kitchen with heated floors, a soothing queen bedroom w/vaulted ceiling & vanity sink, retro-tiled bathroom, living rm with gas fireplace, warm maple floors and comfy sofa-bed. 1 block south of Main , our landmark revolving horse, vibrant cafes, coffee-shops, boutiques and more are steps away! Includes parking spot.
neighborhood_overview:
SoBo Cottage is located 1 block from the historic Revolving Horse on the corner of Main Street & South Bozeman Avenue. Dozens of restaurants, coffee shops, bakeries, and bars are within walking distance with entertainment, nightlife and shopping minutes from the front door: Farmers Markets - The Emerson, Bogert Park, Fairgrounds; Festivals & Fairs- Sweet Pea, Slam Fest, Gallatin County Fair; Live Theater - The Ellen Theatre, Shakespeare in the Parks, Verge Theater, Bozeman Actors Theater; Live Music - The Rialto, The Ellen, The Elm; Indie Film - The Bozeman Film Society; Music on Main -Enjoy it from our front yard!; Art Walk & Christmas Stroll, plus much more make SoBo Cottage the perfect landing spot to experience Bozeman!

Montana State University is a short drive or a 10 minute walk to the South. The Post Office, Community Food Co-op, Ace Hardware are 1 block away. You simply can't find a place closer to the hub of downtown Bozeman!
host_about: Welcome and thanks for checking out SoBo Cottage! I'm a longtime Bozeman-ite, graduating from Bozeman High and Montana State University after spending my youth traveling the world with my family in the military. I live just a few blocks from SoBo Cottage and am excited to share my home and wonderful community with you!

description: Enjoy this pristine clean, nostalgic 1960s basement apartment in a nice neighborhood within walking distance to midtown and downtown, bike/walking paths, numerous eateries, galleries, and shops.
neighborhood_overview:
This home is in the heart of Bozeman. 9 block walk to Down Town.

Recommended hiking trails:
Sypes Canyon
The "M" Trail
Middle Cottonwood
Hyalite (any hikes)
Drinking Horse
Galligator Trail
Lava Lake
Pete's Hill
Bear Canyon

Recommended Drinking Spots:
Feel free to take a growler or two to fill at one of our local craft breweries:

The Bozeman Brewing Company. This is a great place to go after a day on the mountain or the river. The patrons are local. The owners and employees are friends. The beer is outstanding.

Bridger Brewing is across town on campus and also one of our favorites. The pizza at Bridger Brewing is excellent.

MAP brewing is a great place to have a beer.

The dive bars are The Filler, The Eagles, The Crystal, and The Hauf. Each often feature live music. The Hauf has live music nightly.

Plonk and the Open Range feature outstanding mixed drinks, wine

name: Comfortable and Modern Bozeman Abode
description: Situated on quiet street in the heart of Bozeman, minutes from downtown, with many options for dining, entertainment & shopping. This lovely place is a great home base!  Go enjoy the surrounding mountains and rivers, experience the Montana life style! Montana summers are fabulous & there are great day trip hikes in every direction. Montana winters are perfect for curling up with a good book … or go play in the snow!  SORRY NO PETS.  Sadly We had to change our policy due to damage.
neighborhood_overview: This house is a 30 minute walk from the central old town area.  There are coffee shops within five minutes walk -Cold Smoke Coffee house - Starbucks etc.  Grocery shopping is also nearby.  Kirk Park is a beautiful park that is two blocks away.
host_about:
Hello fellow travelers!  My husband and I love to travel and we love to stay in Airbnb’s.  
We realized that this is the best way to stay so in 2018 we set up a home in Phoenix  (where we live) so that our kids and our grandkids could have a place to stay when they come visit.  We also have a home in Montana, which is where I am from.  Much of my family still lives in Bozeman so we set up our home away from so we wouldn’t wear out our welcome when we come to visit!  Our Bozeman abode is beautiful and is located in the heart of the town.    We are very glad to be able to share our home away from home airbnb’s with you!

name: ADU | Stylish Guesthouse | Walk to Downtown!
description:
Your perfect Bozeman getaway awaits! This charming, architect-designed studio guesthouse is ideal for couples, offering everything you need for a short stay or an extended retreat. Enjoy radiant floor heating, a full-size bathtub, a washer and dryer, a dishwasher, a French press, and a spacious outdoor patio. We're dog-friendly (with a fee), and have a private fenced backyard for your pup to run around.

*Dedicated workspace & WiFi
*Full kitchen
*Laundry
*Spacious bathroom
*Blocks from downtown
neighborhood_overview:
The guesthouse is located in a beautiful residential neighborhood, a half-mile from Main Street in Bozeman, 10 miles from Bozeman Airport, 16 miles from Bridger Bowl Ski Area, 45 miles from Big Sky, 85 miles to the north entrance to Yellowstone, and 90 miles to the west entrance to Yellowstone.

Walk to downtown Bozeman where you’ll find cute coffee shops, great dining options, locally-owned boutiques, cool bars, and much more!

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries.
You're a walk or a bike ride away from downtown, the Cannery Distr
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

Enjoy this beautifully restored, one-bedroom, fully-furnished apartment within a house, with its own private entrance. Located in a quiet neighborhood, just a 6 min walk north of Main Street and an 8 min walk to Wild Crumb bakery.

Fully-equipped kitchen with stainless fridge, gas stove, dishwasher, woodblock countertop. Dining room table seats six. High speed wifi. Free onsite parking. Washer/dryer. Great space for reading and relaxing. Wooden floors with Moroccan rugs.

host_about: Hello! I've been an airbnb host and traveler for many years. What I love most about Bozeman is the community... and of course enjoying the snow, hot springs, documentary films, great coffee, and tasty beer.

name: Downtown Bungalow - side door
description: Our Downtown Bungalow has the feel of a cottage in a quiet historic downtown neighborhood, two blocks from restaurants, pubs, shops, boutiques, groceries, historic theater, our beautiful library, parks, creeks, and walking trails. It is an ideal location for guests who are traveling through, college bound visitors, professors, students, skiers, bicyclers, families, etc. Guests without transportation are able to get around with ease to downtown, or walking distance to Montana State University.
host_about:
Welcome to Bozeman and our Downtown Bungalow with your own private entrance and lower level floor, two private bedrooms for individuals or groups, one with a queen bed, the other with one full and twin. There is a shared living room and beautiful bathroom with a Europen style shower, a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, utensils, coffee pot and tea kettle with ground coffee and teas. A bistro table and chairs await you in the garden for your use.
We are located on a quiet street, two blocks from Historic Main Street, restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, boutiques, Bogert Park with their Tuesday night Farmer's Market, a creek, outdoor pool, playground and the base of our amazing trail system from Main Street to the Mountains. We are walking distance to Montana State University, Museum of the Rockies, Bozeman High School, the Community Food Co-op, Bozeman Public Library, Bozeman Deaconess Hospital, and two blocks to our free bus service, including a free downtown shuttle to and from Bridger Bowl Ski Hill.

We are quite the artistic family.
Loretta is a fine artist and educator, muralist, gardener, and bicycler. She exhibits her paintings locally at Cello Gallery and teaches Art Workshops for Adults and children, including Plein Air Landscape Workshops,  Hike Bike Art Camp, plus Art and Sip Parties for all ages and occasions.
Jack is an architectural designer, historian, fine cook, and loves to read. 
He is a skier and hiker of our many local trails.
We love to travel and enjoy exploring nature.
We have two adult children in their twenties.
Our son is a writer and marketer for book publishing. Our daughter is a screen actress.
Our Moto:
Be Active. Explore Nature. Create Art.

name: Peach Street Guesthouse | Best Location in BZN
description:
Garden Guesthouse in Bozeman's best neighborhood. Walking distance to downtown. Two blocks away from Bozeman Brewing and Mountains Walking Brewery. Right across the street from Wild Crumb Bakery (best bakery EVER) and Fink's Deli . 20 minute drive to Bridger Bowl Ski Resort so that you can have first tracks! We have a garden and 4 chickens on the property. They will say hello, you have been warned!
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman's Northside neighborhood has character and attracts local businesses. The best breweries, bakeries, and restaurants around every corner.   The area is quickly transforming into the Arts District. Lots to do right out the front door.
host_about:
Hello there, my name is Emily :)
I live with my partner, Ben.

We love to climb mountains, ski & snowboard, go fishing and get outside as much as we can. Bozeman has access to endless amounts of outdoor recreation, which is one of the main reasons we both ended up in this mountain town.

We are both in the hospitality industry. Ben is a product designer and I am in marketing. 

We are passionate about becoming great hosts and sharing the place that we call home. Please feel free to reach out to us if you have any questions. 

We look forward to having you as our guest! 

Welcome to Bozeman!

There is Nordic skiing, snow shoeing, ice climbing, hunting, snowmobiling and much more. If you need a break from the outdoors don’t fret. Bozeman has amazing eateries, shops, nightlife and offers a rich arts and cultural experience with a number of galleries, museums and historical points of interest.

This area is perfect for a family getaway, a romantic vacation, or even a solo trip.
