name: Cozy & Luxe "Lagom1Stay" Top Floor Loft Downtown
description: This cozy "Lagom" loft is a well appointed stay. A short walk to downtown Bozeman & MSU. Enjoy the local foodie & shopping scenes. Venture to Yellowstone National Park. Enjoy unforgettable Montana experiences hiking & biking in the mountains or fishing in the rivers. Hit the local world class Big Sky Ski Resort or Bridger Bowl, & soak in local Hot Springs. Retire in luxury & comfort while watching the sun peak over the Mountains from your private balcony. City Hosting Permit Number #STR20-00391
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy the quieter side of downtown "South-Side" Bozeman, Montana. Nestled in the "Gallatin Valley" surrounded by 7 Mountain ranges! During your stay at the "Cozy Lagom1 SOBO Loft," you will be located in a beautiful & walkable historically established neighborhood with mature trees. Montana State University is right up the road. Take a walk through "MSU" campus to "The Museum of the Rockies" where you may explore early history in the Rocky Mountain Western regions, dinosaur bones, fossils, special exhibits & planetarium shows. "Emerson Cultural Center, Rialto, Elm, & The Willson Auditorium" for performance/concert venues are all short walkable distances away. If you enjoy breezing through the city there are scooters strewn across the town during summer months. Walking distances to parks, playgrounds, & trails. Montana mornings & evenings tend to be on the cooler side no matter what time of year so don't forget to bring clothing options.

In the winter the fun is just beginnin
host_about:
We are Abigail & Eric! We are excited to have you stay! Born & raised Montanans, designer & builder come together to create a beautiful Montana experience just for you.  We are excited to help you navigate Montana & can send a guide on what to bring based on what adventures you plan on having. We have recommendations galore! Want to go skiing, hiking, have day trips, or enjoy fishing? Go out & have an incredible meal, enjoy local walks, & events? We are happy to assist. Montana is truly "Big Sky" country & has the ability to take your breath away. These trips are memories which last. 

Our family enjoys an array of outdoor adventures & love traveling to experience local moments wherever we go. We ski, snowboard, ice-skate, sled, hike, & dip into hot springs. On our hikes we love waterfalls & enjoy sitting around a fire in the mountains sipping on honey tea. Life is a sensory experience & we are thrilled to share these beautiful places we enjoy immensely with you.

name: Immaculate Downtown Bozeman Condo 1 Block off Main
description: Enjoy downtown Bozeman and beyond in this beautiful and cozy Montana Mid-Century Modern condo, a conveniently located 2020 construction only one block from Main! Perfect for couples or the single traveler, you'll have a reserved parking space, a fully-equipped kitchen, high speed WiFi, smart TV with cable, a private balcony to enjoy your morning coffee, convenient 24-7 keyless access from your phone (or a code), and many more amenities as described below. We look forward to welcoming you!
neighborhood_overview:
During your stay, you will be conveniently located in the heart of Bozeman.

Social life can be found less than a block to the north at Bozeman’s legendary “Barmuda Triangle”, a favorite collection of three unique drinking establishments popular among locals and visitors alike - the Molly Brown, the Scoop Bar, and the Haufbrau. (As an aside - the condo sits at the opposite side of the building as this area, so you won’t hear any noises from the famous “Triangle”. Just another perk of this particular unit!).

Also within a stone’s throw north, you can grab a bagel at Bagelworks, a cold treat from Sweet Peaks Ice Cream, or hit up Maven’s Market for some quality cheese and wine.

A few blocks west of the building you will find the Bozeman Co-Op, which offers a host of local and organic groceries in addition to a very popular soup, salad, and entrée buffet. Here you will also find a fine sampling of local beers and wine. If you're in the mood for delicious
host_about:
Ambrose is a front-end web developer, video game developer, and short-story writer. Jill is a software engineer, a violinist for the Bozeman Symphony Orchestra, a private math tutor, and fluent German speaker. We both love meeting new people and sharing the beauty of Bozeman.

As guests, we are respectful of the space, clean and tidy, laid back, and polite. We love exploring new areas,  eating at exotic restaurants, and learning about the local history and architecture. Being hosts ourselves, we are mindful of what goes into hosting and want to make things as easy and pleasant as possible for all parties.

name: Trailer Glamping of Story Hills
description: Welcome to the Trailer Glamper of Story Hills.  The best feature of our 33 ft trailer is the location.  Our property is 3 acres of mountain views and one mile from downtown.  It’s a short walk to local coffee shops, breweries, etc. Access Bozeman's trail system from our gate; Bridger Bowl  is 20 minutes away and MSU is 15 minutes by bike. We have the best of all worlds, a country feel, the amenities of a city, and easy access to wilderness adventures.
neighborhood_overview: We live in the ecclectic and unique Northeast side of Bozeman.  Its not trendy but is well known for the Wild Crumb Bakery, Mountains Walking Brewery, Fink's Deli and other local food trucks. The Story Mill Community Park is just outside our back gate and links you to an amazing trail system that takes you to the Bridger Mountains. Beautiful, historic, downtown Bozeman is one walkable mile away.
host_about: We have lived in Bozeman since 1991; married in 1998; and have owned this property since 2002. This is the place our three kids call home with space enough to ride horses, build snow forts and ski jumps, have huge backyard BBQ's and bonfires. Troy comes from an entrepreneurial background including the fitness business, film industry, insurance, and communication coaching. Lei-Anna has been in public education and currently consults with and travels to school districts around the country. We have a deep love and respect for the wilderness that surrounds us, the Greater Yellowstone, in addition to exercise, meditation, and a belief in a healthy organic and sustainable lifestyle.

name: Bozeman 303: Your Bozeman Basecamp!
description:
Welcome to Your Bozeman basecamp! Whether your outdoor adventure is hiking, skiing, or fishing, everything is within reach; including Big Sky Resort and Yellowstone National Park. Here for business, you found the perfect place. Our beautiful and efficient condo is a 15 minute drive from Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport, 60 minutes from Big Sky, 20 minutes from Bridger Bowl and steps away from Montana State University, great local shops, restaurants and grocery stores.

STR20-00399
neighborhood_overview: Nestled into one of Bozeman's iconic craftsman style neighborhoods from the early 1900's and just two blocks from both it's historic downtown and local food markets, Bozeman 303 is the perfect location. Hiking trails, world class skiing, natural hot springs and Yellowstone National Park are all just a short drive away.  Bozeman offers a wide variety of dining and shopping experiences. Whether you enjoy upscale or casual dining, a local microbrew from one of our 12 breweries or a hand crafted cocktail, downtown Bozeman has exactly what you are looking for. Seeking local art, antiques or books? How about gear for your next adventure? The shopping scene in Bozeman does not disappoint.
host_about: A fellow Airbnb host, I love to travel and explore new places, meet new people and experience new things.

name: Bozeman Retreat - Clean, Comfortable, Downtown
description: The Bozeman Retreat is just seven blocks from downtown and only a few blocks from midtown Bozeman. This new highly efficient contemporary home features a full kitchen, local TV, Roku, WiFi, stereo with Bluetooth, keyless entry, washer, dryer, coffee maker, filtered water, in-floor heat, new appliances, and welcoming decor. Guests will sleep well on a medium-profile hybrid mattress combining the benefits of a traditional innerspring with a thick layer of cushioning memory foam. There is plenty of parking and the retreat is easy to get to and from wherever your travels might take you.
neighborhood_overview: The Bozeman Retreat is in the 'old' or original part of Bozeman. Homes in this area are a mix of original homes that were built in the 1930's to new homes like the Retreat. There is an elementary school a few blocks to the west. Downtown is five to seven blocks away. Bozeman's Midtown is five blocks away. The street is quiet with really not much more traffic than residential.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

name: Smack Dab in the Middle of Bozeman!
description:
Here in the Heart of Bozeman life can be whatever you want: quiet and simple or exciting and adventurous--all in the same day!
Whether you're on vacation or working in the valley, we've outfitted our home to be YOUR home while you're here. We are excited to welcome you to Bozeman, and to invite you to enjoy all this beautiful area has to offer!
neighborhood_overview:
The Walton Homestead subdivision is a quiet and inviting neighborhood with a family-friendly atmosphere and views of the Bridger Mountains. The yard and an open space behind the house gives kids and four-legged friends a place to stretch their legs and there's a full park and playground less than one block away. (Note: the yard is NOT fenced.)
Being at almost the exact geographic center of Bozeman, you'll be minutes away from everything: shopping, groceries, fine dining, fast food, the Gallatin Valley Mall, gyms, hiking (at multiple regional parks within city limits,) coffee shops, bars, cinemas, live theater, music venues, spas and salons, bowling, the Bozeman Swim Center, the Bozeman Beach, churches, not to mention the real reason so many people want to visit Bozeman--the skiing, fishing, golfing, hiking, camping, climbing and dozens of other outdoor activities the people of this town love so much!

name: The Granny Flat
description:
Bright, spacious and clean 1 BR/1BA guesthouse. Complete with all amenities needed for a relaxing getaway, including king size Tuft and Needle bed (comfort heavily noted in our reviews), washer/dryer, Roku TV, high speed internet, and well equipped kitchen.

Short distance to West Side restaurants or downtown shops. Multiple nearby parks and ponds.

Apartment is over detached garage with an independent door leading to an enclosed stairwell.
neighborhood_overview:
Flanders Mill is a newer neighborhood on the west side of town. Wide sidewalks welcome you to take a nice walk or jog. Take a lap to one of the many parks both in and around the neighborhood. The Gallatin County Regional park is just a block away with a large fenced in dog park, a couple lakes, a kid friendly playground and additional walking paths.

If you're looking for a good meal, look no further than the The Market at Ferguson Farm, where you're sure to find something for everyone. A walk-able or bike-able dining and retail experience just a couple blocks south of the apartment.

description:
Cute small home right by the Linear Trail and close walking distance to downtown and campus. Single level,​ full of sunlight​,​ plants​,​ and beautiful textiles. There is a shared washer and drier with the downstairs tenant. The home has wood floors​,​ a bathtub​,​ a blooming lemon tree​,​ and a backyard garden - but no dishwasher​,​ microwave or TV.

House is only available for stays longer than 30 days.

Cozy apartment in Bozeman with spectacular mountain views. Close access to hiking, skiing, fishing, and everything else that brings you to Montana!

Apartments includes fully furnished kitchen, single bedroom with dresser and closet, full bathroom, free wash/dryer, WIFI, and TV with streaming apps.

Photos were taken shortly after completion. All windows other than the stairway have blinds installed.

name: Chic Bozeman Apartment - 1 Block Off West Main St!
description: Nestled in the heart of Bozeman and featuring bright, welcoming style, this 1-bedroom, 1-bath apartment will host your next stay with ease! The vacation rental boasts multiple walkable restaurants, while a short drive will bring you to Montana State University, the Museum of the Rockies, and much more if you stay in town. Hop in the car to access Rocky Mountain fun in Yellowstone National Park, Bridger Bowl Ski Area, and Big Sky Resort, not to mention hiking in Custer Gallatin National Forest!

NEARBY HIGHLIGHTS (< 1 mile): Sweet Peaks Ice Cream, Backcountry Burger Bar, Rialto, Bozeman Taproom & Spirits, Feed Cafe, Bozeman Co-op West Main, Dave's Sushi - Off Main, Bozeman Co-op Downtown, Western Cafe
BREWERIES: Union Hall Brewery (0.5 miles), Lockhorn Cider House (0.9 miles), Montana Ale Works (1.0 miles), Mountains Walking Brewery (1.5 miles), Bozeman Brewing Company (1.5 miles), Bridger Brewing (1.5 miles), Bunkhouse Brewery (1.5 miles)

OUTDOOR RECREATION: Gallatin County Regional Park (3.4 miles), Bridger Creek Golf Course (3.8 miles), Montana Grizzly Encounter (11.8 miles), Bridger Bowl Ski Area (17.5 miles), Big Sky Resort

name: Bozeman Retreat: Hip, Clean, Comfortable, Downtown
description: The Bozeman Retreat is just seven blocks from downtown and only a few blocks from midtown Bozeman. This new highly efficient contemporary home features a full kitchen, local TV, Roku, WiFi, stereo with Bluetooth, keyless entry, washer, dryer, coffee maker, filtered water, in-floor heat, new appliances, and welcoming decor. There is plenty of off-street parking and the retreat is easy to get to and from wherever your travels might take you.
neighborhood_overview: The Bozeman Retreat is in the 'old' or original part of Bozeman. Homes in this area are a mix of original homes that were built in the 1930's to new homes like the Retreat. There is an elementary school a few blocks to the west. Downtown is five to seven blocks away. Bozeman Midtown is a growing area and this is about five blocks away. The street is quite with really not much more traffic than residential.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

name: Downtown Bungalow - front door
description: Our Downtown Bungalow has the feel of a cottage in a quiet historic downtown neighborhood, two blocks from restaurants, pubs, shops, boutiques, groceries, historic theater, our beautiful library, parks, creeks, and walking trails. It is an ideal location for guests who are traveling through, college bound visitors, professors, students, skiers, bicyclers, families, etc. Guests without transportation are able to get around with ease to downtown or Montana State University.
neighborhood_overview: Our Downtown Bungalow has the feel of a cottage in a quiet historic downtown neighborhood, two blocks from restaurants, pubs, shops, boutiques, groceries, historic theater, our beautiful library, parks, creeks, and walking trails. It is an ideal location for guests who are traveling through, college bound visitors, professors, students, skiers, bicyclers, families, etc. Guests without transportation are able to get around with ease to downtown or Montana State University.
host_about:
Welcome to Bozeman and our Downtown Bungalow with your own private entrance and lower level floor, two private bedrooms for individuals or groups, one with a queen bed, the other with one full and twin. There is a shared living room and beautiful bathroom with a Europen style shower, a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, utensils, coffee pot and tea kettle with ground coffee and teas. A bistro table and chairs await you in the garden for your use.
We are located on a quiet street, two blocks from Historic Main Street, restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, boutiques, Bogert Park with their Tuesday night Farmer's Market, a creek, outdoor pool, playground and the base of our amazing trail system from Main Street to the Mountains. We are walking distance to Montana State University, Museum of the Rockies, Bozeman High School, the Community Food Co-op, Bozeman Public Library, Bozeman Deaconess Hospital, and two blocks to our free bus service, including a free downtown shuttle to and from Bridger Bowl Ski Hill.

We are quite the artistic family.
Loretta is a fine artist and educator, muralist, gardener, and bicycler. She exhibits her paintings locally at Cello Gallery and teaches Art Workshops for Adults and children, including Plein Air Landscape Workshops,  Hike Bike Art Camp, plus Art and Sip Parties for all ages and occasions.
Jack is an architectural designer, historian, fine cook, and loves to read. 
He is a skier and hiker of our many local trails.
We love to travel and enjoy exploring nature.
We have two adult children in their twenties.
Our son is a writer and marketer for book publishing. Our daughter is a screen actress.
Our Moto:
Be Active. Explore Nature. Create Art.

name: Beall Street Bungalow-3 blocks from Downtown
description: Welcome to Bozeman MT where skiing, fishing, hiking, and Yellowstone National Park are at your fingertips.  And if you are staying in Bozeman then why not stay steps from where all the buzz happens?  Our 1 bedroom with a king size bed, a Murphy pullout in the living room, and 1 bath house is located 3 blocks from the center of downtown.  Perfect for a couple or a traveling family. We are just steps away from restaurants, boutiques, coffee shops, theaters, and great bars.
neighborhood_overview: When visiting Bozeman there really is no better place to stay then right in the heart of downtown. Your house is 3 blocks away to the center of the downtown. There are so many great restaurants, boutiques, art galleries, coffee shops, beauty, and nightlife right around the corner from your location on Main Street. Nine blocks the other way gives you access to the shuttle that will take you directly to the ski area at Bridger Bowl.  You will also find a big park located just a block away. Whether you are here for the skiing, hiking, fishing, or visit to Yellowstone you will find our location a great base area for all your fun!
host_about: Tommy and I are a young couple that both grew up in the area.  We enjoy traveling and meeting new people along the way. name: Downtown Bozeman Western Cottage
description: Enjoy this log home in Bozeman’s most soulful neighborhood.  Walkable to the famous Wild Crumb Bakery, Treeline Cafe, Mountains Walking Brewery, and Downtown Bozeman.  This 1940s traditional Montana cottage is the perfect retreat to experience life like a local.  Backyard, private parking, and a safe neighborhood will help you rest easy at night.
neighborhood_overview: We may be a bit biased, but we think our house boasts the absolute best location in all of Bozeman. Within a 5 minute walk of our home is an incredible bakery (Wild Crumb), the best coffee the city has to offer (Treeline), many great breweries, restaurants,  bars, the main street of town with cute shops, and trails galore webbing out from the Bozeman Public Library (yup,our library moonlights as a trailhead!) Despite being so close to everything,  the house is on an incredibly quiet street, nestled amongst other charming homes.
host_about:
Some numbers: In the (12) years I’ve been a member of the AirBnB community, I've stayed in over (100) AirBnBs across (6) continents, rented out (5) of my living spaces while traveling, and met my (1)  husband while staying in his AirBnB.  

To say I love this platform is an understatement.  It has fundamentally changed how I navigate the world and provides me with the freedom to see more of it.

I aim to be the best host you've ever had because I understand first hand how important accommodation is to a great experience on the road. 

I aim to be the best guest you've ever had because I understand how personal it is to open up your home to travelers.

name: ADU208: Immaculate 1-bedroom downtown ADU
description: Unwind in the sizable comforts of this small modern space.
neighborhood_overview: ADU208 is five blocks from the center of downtown Bozeman. It is four blocks from the heart of Bozeman's Northeast Neighborhood.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

name: Access Friendly Location. Airport, MSU & Trails
description:
Bring the whole family (plus pet) for your basecamp in Bozeman. Ideally located near MSU, Yellowstone National Park and the airport for your work commute.

This spacious property offers an abundance of space for spreading your luggage out in each bedroom (3). A full kitchen is provided with use of pots, pans, Ninja blender, cast iron pans and more. High speed internet is included along with free parking.

This is a non-smoking household. Please enjoy at a near park and not in or at the house.
host_about: Avid outdoor enthusiast making the most out of exploring Montana and opening my doors to help you do the same! As a Bozeman resident for just over 3 years, originally hailing from the Great Lakes state of Michigan, I'm driven to put many miles in by foot, bike, skis and water ways. The state boasts incredible recreational opportunities with two spectacular National Parks and countless National Forests. Reach out as I'm always happy to recommend lovely meandering trails or delicious food around the area.

name: Private 2 Bedroom Suite - Near Downtown & MSU
description:
Base your Bozeman stay at our private, clean, cozy, bright, and convenient 2 queen bedroom/1 bath BASEMENT suite in our 1950s home near Downtown and MSU. We can host up to 4 guests. 2 desks, WiFi, 2 Smart Roku TVs, laundry, linens & toiletries. Efficient kitchen and dining area.
Off street parking and separate guest entrance with keypad.
Near restaurants, breweries, coffee shops and more!
Minutes to downtown 5, MSU 5, Bridger Bowl 25, Big Sky 55, BZN airport 20.
neighborhood_overview:
Quiet, safe, centrally located residential neighborhood with quick access to Downtown, MSU, the interstate and the airport.

Cooper Park and the MSU campus are just a short walk away.

Grocery: There are 3 grocery stores (Safeway, Albertsons, Town n Country) ~3/4 of a mile away and the Community Food Coop is a 12 min walk/2 min drive away.
Pharmacy: CVS, Safeway and Osco pharmacies are nearby if you need medications or incedentals.
host_about:
Sarah and I love living in Bozeman but also like to travel and adventure throughout the western US and the world, often on bikes. At home we spend our free time outdoors hiking, running, riding mountain and gravel bikes in the summer and nordic skiing, snow biking, and ice climbing in the winter. When traveling we prioritize exploration and adventures.

As hosts we welcome you and try hard to provide a clean, comfortable, convenient, and affordable base for your Bozeman visit and adventures. We are happy to share years of local knowledge about fun things to do in the Bozeman area including hiking, skiing, backpacking, ice climbing, mountain-biking, visiting Yellowstone National Park, and places to shop or eat around town.

name: King Bed, Workstation, & Fast WiFi
description:
Digital Nomad Dream Apartment

This 1 bedroom / 1 bath apartment is right smack dab in the middle of Bozeman. 1.2 miles to Downtown, 3.4 miles to the hospital, 17 miles to Bridger Bowl, and 44 miles to Big Sky

100mbps WiFi + desk & ergonomic chair + 21" Monitor with HDMI port

Very private and quiet. No shared walls with neighbors.

Free Parking right outside your door.

In-unit washer + dryer.

neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of Central Bozeman. Mix of residential and commercial buildings.
host_about:
Hi there! My name is Cooper and I grew up in the lowcountry of South Carolina. I developed a love for the outdoors at a very young age and enjoy hiking, mountain biking, and anything on the water. 

I work remote for a software company you have probably used before and love the flexibility it gives me in terms of work locations / home offices. I have been to 32+ countries and want to keep adding to my list. What is your favorite country? 

When I travel I prefer to stay for longer visits to spread my roots into the local communities. 28+ day stays are my speciality so all of my units are equipped for mid term stays. Think standup desks, fast wifi, everything you need to cook, and welcoming spaces.

Making sure you have a smooth check in and the ability to ask any questions during your stay is my #1 priority.

name: Downtown Bozeman Main Street Suite
description: This 2nd floor brick lined presidential suite offers a 1,000 sq ft loft on Main Street.  See pictures of two curtained sleeping areas, a gas fireplace, high ceilings, stocked kitchenette with microwave, toaster & air fryer for preparing food, stone bathroom, formal dining area & living room. Out your front door find historic buildings housing cultural centers, live theater, music venues, coffee houses, restaurants and retail stores. Next to the historic Baxter Hotel there is easy access to I-90.
neighborhood_overview:
Take a Walk Down Main Street
Enjoy Historical Downtown Bozeman!
Be a local and walk from your new home in Historic Downtown Bozeman to the many sights, eateries and museums lining Main Street: Jam Eatery, Tree Line Coffee, Emerson Cultural Center, The Ellen Theater, Gallatin History Museum, Rialto Music Venue, Bozeman Food Co-op, Lululemon, Country Book Shelf, Schnees Shoes, Black Bird Kitchen, Theory Hair Salon, The Market Place, Backcountry Burger Bar and The Bozeman Public Library. Bozeman is where new vogue culture meets legendary history.
Take it all in by living in the heart of what John Bozeman found so intriguing years ago.



Ready for an Adventure?
Rent a bike from Owenhouse Cycling or walk from the Downtown Public Library on the Gallagator Trail south to The Museum of the Rockies and meet the local dinosaurs!
Next, tour around Montana State University to see what all the hype is about!
Travel back home through the sou
host_about:
Hi, 
Welcome to Bozeman where my husband and I have been in the hospitality industry for close to 40 years. We owned and operated a restaurant on Main Street and most recently host vacation rentals. It is truly our passion, and it is our goal to meet your expectations for your time in Bozeman. We know the area like the back of our hand and would be delighted to answer questions and guide you in the right direction:)
We look forward to hosting you in 
Montana’s Big Sky Country!

name: Dwell Skyview
description: Newly built in 2017 and already a favorite. Remote work haven in prime location, free/fast WiFi. Keyless self check-in. Smart TV.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Luxury Bozeman, Montana Cottage Rental
description:
In order to truly experience Bozeman and the abundance of attractions that make Montana "the most livable place", we would love for you to visit and even stay a while! Welcome to The Cottage: a luxury free standing condo offering both nightly and 30+ day stays, just minutes from downtown Bozeman with shopping and nightlife.

The Cottage was built with opulence, functionalism and attention to detail at the core of every design decision. A home away from home, the Lux Cottage is waiting for you.
host_about:
Howdy! Welcome to Montana. I was born and raised on a working horse ranch in the heart of Paradise Valley, specifically Tom Miner Basin along the banks of the Yellowstone River. My parents continue to thrive on the ranch while my siblings and I went out into the world to pursue educations and other interests. My love for Montana brought me home in 2012, when I launched my vacation rental management business- MonTanya Yellowstone Properties & Concierge.

I'm based in Livingston and look forward to welcoming and accommodating you in southwest Montana.

name: Modern Downtown Condo, block off Main Street!
description: This newly-built condo is exactly where you want to stay to get the full Bozeman experience! A short walk away from Main Street's highly rated restaurants and eclectic local shops. Close to Montana State University, making it easy to hop on a tour or explore the campus yourself. If you’re wanting to explore the Big Sky Country, this condo is a short drive from the outdoors and a has all the comforts of home when you’re ready to relax. Also, a perfect setup to work remotely.
neighborhood_overview: Downtown Bozeman is home to hundreds of thriving retailers, restaurants, and professional services. Bozeman and the entire greater Yellowstone region have so much to offer visitors. The quality of experiences enjoyed in Bozeman is largely determined by its amazing mountain setting which provides endless outdoor recreation opportunities. From skiing in the winter to fishing and hiking in the summer, Bozeman is a fabulous basecamp for exploring all that Southwest Montana has to offer. For being a small mountain town, Bozeman has a surprisingly impressive culinary scene. No matter what budget you're on or how picky you are, there are options for everyone, and the variety is growing by the day. Bozeman has every tasty bite you can imagine, from southern fried chicken to Korean bibimbap; from wood-fired pizza to fresh poke burritos. Bozeman is very fortunate to have a thriving arts and culture community. Highlights include our new “green” public library and the world-renowned Museum of the
host_about:
I am a working professional who works from home. I live in Bozeman, Montana for part of the year and rent my condo there out and travel frequently. 
I love living in Bozeman because of the natural beauty of Montana and the variety of outdoor activities that can be done year round with few crowds. Also, Bozeman has a friendly small mountain town feel with city conveniences including access to great restaurants, shopping, and nightlife. I am originally from Chicago and enjoy skiing, hiking, and riding a crossover motorcycle.

description: Beautiful condo with easy access to all Bozeman has to offer. Walkable to downtown, enjoy restaurants, bars, shops & nightlife. description: Welcome to your home in downtown Bozeman! This 3-bedroom, 1,500 sq. foot house has been our home for 16 years and we are excited to now share it with guests and visitors to Bozeman. This is as close to downtown a single-family home can be. Only two blocks to Main Street and 100 yards to Dave’s Sushi. This home was built in 1918 and the second story was added in 2002. The open, spacious downstairs living area is the perfect place to call home while you explore all that the Bozeman area offers.
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman's northeast neighborhood consists of charming and eclectic homes with easy access to downtown and great parks.
host_about: I moved to Bozeman in 2002 to ski-bum and...never left! I work for a Bozeman-based adventure travel company that plans trips to Yellowstone, Montana, and other beautiful natural places beyond. Extending this hospitality to hosting guests at our home has been very rewarding. I hope you have fun exploring all that Bozeman and the surrounding area offers. It's worth checking out!

name: Modern Guest Suite, 3 Miles from Downtown Bozeman
description:
Our 1,000 square foot, family friendly, modern yet uniquely Montanan home is in a prime location!

We are centrally located with a 5-10 min drive to bars, restaurants, and all that Bozeman has to offer. 6 miles to the mouth of Hyalite Canyon, 20 miles from Bridger Bowl, 1.5 miles from Bobcat Stadium, 40 miles from Big Sky, and an hour and a half drive to Yellowstone National Park.

description:
Our cozy apartment is in an ideal location near Montana State University and downtown Bozeman.

Whether you are traveling to Bozeman for work or adventure, it is the perfect home base. With a beautiful shared backyard, a park just one block away, and the Gallagator trail two blocks away, our home is a great place to experience all that Bozeman has to offer. Enjoy your stay in this cozy apartment, equipped with all of the comforts of home.
host_about:
My husband and I are born and raised here in Montana. We love all of the hiking, skiing and biking that this area has to offer. We also love enjoying the many National Parks in our state.

• Recently renovated chalet

• Full kitchen with breakfast bar

• Dedicated workspace

Hosting Permit: STR23-00020
neighborhood_overview:
This delightful Montana apartment for 4 is located in an upscale neighborhood of Bozeman. It’s a quiet and pleasant location that’s ideal for families or couples to escape to for a weekend, week, or longer, and for remote workers looking for somewhere to base themselves in Montana.

The property sits in the heart of walking & biking trails, parks, and all kinds of outdoor adventures, making it the perfect basecamp for getting out and seeing all that Bozeman and Montana have to offer on foot, bikes or by car.

Nearby places you might be interested in checking out during your stay include:

Yellowstone National Park - always a big attraction for people from all over the world with views, trails and landscapes you’ll remember for a lifetime.

Montana State University - the largest university in the state is close by, so if you’re a student or parents of a student looking to study here, the chalet is a great place to base yourselves while you’re chec
host_about:
I am a 30-something local resident of Bozeman, MT where I live and work as a VP at a digital transformation agency. 

I love traveling and spending time with my friends and family.  I enjoy all outdoor activities, hiking, backpacking, camping, fly fishing and watching football. 

Cheers!

name: Bozeman Bison Bunker - Near Montana State MSU
description: Come be one of the first to stay at our Bozeman Bison Bunker just minutes from Montana State University. With a view of the M and just a 5 minute drive to the University, you won't find a better space during your stay in Bozeman. Enjoy this designer space with 9' kitchen island, 65" Samsung smart tv, and full size washer and dryer. This is a brand new property with stairs above a garage but not sharing any walls with others. We're the owners living in the larger side available to help.
neighborhood_overview: Gran Cielo is the manifestation of our dedication to create community through a common living space. While its million-dollar views, unmatched central park, and easy access to downtown Bozeman and the wild beyond make Gran Cielo an enticing location, it’s the sense of classic community that sets it apart. Whether you’re looking for your first home, a bit more space, or somewhere to settle indefinitely, Gran Cielo offers a sophisticated array of home types, sizes and styles. Unique architectural details and contemporary design draw residents in, but it’s the community’s centerpiece, a world class central park, that draws them together.

host_about:
Please call me Bob! I am the founder and chief scientist at the Yellowstone Ecological Research Center (YERC). Over my 30-plus years working in the Greater Yellowstone, my research interests have sought a more holistic connection between nature, people, and technology. That’s led to what I call “Adaptive Ecology,” studying not only how ecosystems adapt to changing conditions, but how the science of ecology must adapt to social and technological changes as well. That focus drives YERC’s mission today.

Personally, I enjoy meeting people from all walks of life and finding common ground among cultures and communities.  I love sharing my knowledge of the Greater Yellowstone area and ecology, the best places to spot local wildlife, and my favorite watering holes in the area.

name: The Westside Bozeman Nook - Cozy Destination
description:
Centrally located in Gallatin County, 60 minutes to Big Sky Resort, 30 minutes to Bridger Bowl, 10 minutes to downtown Bozeman, 10 minutes to Montana State University, walking distance to shops and restaurants on the growing west side of town.
Take a break between adventures to take advantage of the full coffee bar or take a nap on the premium king size bed. My garage is full of tuning equipment and extra gear, if you think you need something I'm happy to help.
neighborhood_overview:
Valley West is a great neighborhood on the west side of town with in walking distance to The Ridge ( a gym), a juice bar, a yoga studio, Polar Brewing ( brewery), restaurants Tanglewood, Sidewinders, Hachi Sushi, Foxtrot (also a coffee stop) .
The neighborhood is mostly full of families.
There is a nice mature tress and custom houses to enjoy a walk around with a cup of coffee. If you go a block east you will find a large pond full of ducks along with a community park with walking trails.
host_about:
Hello! I moved to Bozeman after college and stayed for the skiing and the community that I've built here the last 18 years. I enjoy hockey, skiing, snowboarding, mountain biking and rafting. 
For work I am a Vacation Rental Real Estate Investor and Construction Remodeler. 
I grew up in Idaho about 5 hours from here.
In the fall I love to make a nice breakfast and watch College Game day to hear about all the college football games.

name: Little Yellow House - Downtown Charming 2 BDRM
description: Welcome to our cheerful, warm and cozy "little yellow house" located in the historic Cooper Park neighborhood in the heart of Bozeman. Take in the surrounding nature and parks--all within a 5-minute walk to central downtown and a short drive to Bridger Bowl ski area, Hyalite Canyon, the Madison River and many other outdoor recreation destinations. Cared for by Erin, an Airbnb Superhost, you are sure to have the best stay possible!
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in the Cooper Park Historic District, which includes Colonial Revival, Bungalow/craftsman, and Queen Anne architecture. The streets are lined with trees and cute bungalows, most of which are pre-war built.
host_about: Hi! I'm originally from Texas, now living in Montana, working as a documentary photographer. I've traveled all over the world and have lived in Turkey, India, Iraq, and Afghanistan. I'm very clean and respectful, and I take care of other's homes like they were my own. I look forward to hosting you and / or staying at your home!

name: Downtown Bozeman studio! Walk everywhere
description: Experience downtown Bozeman, Montana at this centrally-located suite! This fully furnished studio is perfect walking distance to restaurants, the post office, banks, shopping, coffee shops, and more. It is only a 4-minute drive to Montana State University. It is fully furnished with a well-stocked kitchen, washer/dryer, dedicated workspace, lounge area, and a comfortable bed. You'll feel relaxed and refreshed after a great night's sleep. Off-street Parking is included! Free Wifi
neighborhood_overview:
South of Main Street filled with some of Bozeman’s most historic residences. Quiet streets lined with mature trees and towering Victorian-era homes distinguish this neighborhood. Residences are generally on smaller lots, with many having multiple units and shared back alley access. The Gallagator Linear Trail meanders throughout, connecting neighbors from Main Street to Kagy.

Great for those that want to stay in historic “old Bozeman” and be within walking distance from farmer’s markets and downtown events.

1-4 minutes to downtown

name: West side stay - 10 minutes to everywhere
description:
This is a great space for a Basecamp to your outdoor adventures here in Bozeman. Whether it’s skiing, fishing, or visiting family.
There’s extra space in the garage for storage or gear repairs.
I’m happy to give recommendations on the local attractions.
The room is spacious with a plush king sized bed and up stairs away from the main area in a shared home so you can expect a lot of privacy.
There’s also a set of friendly yet shy retired sled dogs around from time to time.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quiet neighborhood full of families and mature landscaping making it a great place to walk with a cup of coffee.
There is a pond just a block east with a large park to enjoy one a walk.
host_about:
Hello! I moved to Bozeman after college and stayed for the skiing and the community that I've built here the last 18 years. I enjoy hockey, skiing, snowboarding, mountain biking and rafting. 
For work I am a Vacation Rental Real Estate Investor and Construction Remodeler. 
I grew up in Idaho about 5 hours from here.
In the fall I love to make a nice breakfast and watch College Game day to hear about all the college football games.

name: Cozy Valley West Studio | Full Kitchen & Laundry
description:
Whether planning a weekend getaway or an extended stay, this cozy, well-equipped studio is your gateway to relaxation and adventure in Bozeman. Located in the idyllic Valley West neighborhood, enjoy free parking, stunning mountain views, and proximity to a picturesque pond and park. It offers a full kitchen, bathroom, comfy bed, and essentials to make you feel right at home.

*Pet-friendly stay
*Dual washer/dryer
*Air conditioning unit
*Dedicated workspace and wifi
*Great neighborhood
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in Valley West, one of Bozeman’s most desirable neighborhoods. It’s surrounded by trails, a large beautiful pond with mountains as the backdrop, and numerous lovely parks. It’s the perfect location for easy access to outdoor spaces!

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Downtown Charming & Cozy Casita - 3 BDRM
description: This downtown 3-Bedroom charming casita has a unique western-vintage style and is conveniently located in the historic Cooper Park neighborhood in the heart of Bozeman. Take in the surrounding nature and parks within a 5-minute walk to downtown and a short drive to Bridger Bowl, Hyalite Canyon, the Madison River and many other outdoor recreation destinations. Cared for by Erin, a Superhost, you are sure to have the best stay possible!
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in the Cooper Park Historic District, which includes Colonial Revival and Queen Anne architecture. The streets are lined with leafy trees and cute bungalows, most of which are pre-war built.
host_about: Hi! I'm originally from Texas, now living in Montana, working as a documentary photographer. I've traveled all over the world and have lived in Turkey, India, Iraq, and Afghanistan. I love traveling, meeting new people and trying new things. I have been a host and guest on airbnb since 2010, and have had some amazing experiences. I'm very clean and respectful, and I take care of other's homes like they were my own. I look forward to hosting you and / or staying at your home!

name: Waters 1Bd Apt in Valley West | King Bd + Laundry
description:
Our charming apartment in the heart of Valley West awaits you! Nestled in one of Bozeman’s most idyllic neighborhoods, this lovely, private retreat offers the perfect blend of comfort + convenience. Whether you're seeking a cozy weekend getaway or a home base for a month's visit, you'll find everything you need here. Enjoy stunning mountain views, free parking, and a picturesque park and pond just a 1/2 block away.

*Dedicated workspace + wifi
*Laundry
*Private patio
*King bed
*Great location
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in Valley West, one of Bozeman’s most desirable neighborhoods. It’s the perfect location for easy access to outdoor spaces! It is only a half block from the beautiful Valley West Park, pond, and trail system. You’ll also be close to MSU, downtown Bozeman, and Four Corners (on the way to Big Sky).

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Your Downtown Urban Sanctuary: Downtown Luxury!
description:
Discover serenity at the NamaStay Condo Retreat, a haven of tranquility nestled in the heart of Beautiful Downtown Bozeman, Montana. Immerse yourself in a space thoughtfully adorned with a yoga-inspired touches, offering luxury and comfort for a truly rejuvenating escape. Just moments away from vibrant Main Street, NamaStay invites you to explore the city's delightful array of eateries, boutiques, artistic gems, and vibrant nightlife. Embrace the perfect union of urban convenient.
STR23-00086
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman is referred to as one of the “most livable places” for good reason! It is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter what time of year it is. Located in the heart of Downtown Bozeman, VRBozeman's properties offer something for everyone. In the warmer months you can explore the mountains, fly fish on world renowned rivers and streams, mountain bike on miles of trails and enjoy several other outdoor activities. In the winter you are 45 minutes from the largest ski resort in America, Big Sky and 15 minutes from the local hill Bridger Bowl. There is Nordic skiing, snow shoeing, ice climbing, hunting, snowmobiling and much more. If you need a break from the outdoors don’t fret. Bozeman has amazing eateries, shops, nightlife and offers a rich arts and cultural experience with a number of galleries, museums and historical points of interest. This area is perfect for a family getaway, a romantic vacation, or even a solo trip. Come and explore all tha

name: Spacious 1Bdrm Guest Suite Near MSU and Downtown
description:
This modern basement apartment offers abundant natural light and a clean, functional layout. Designed by the homeowner as a guest suite for family and friends, it features new, comfortable furnishings and offers ample privacy from the main house. Step outside to the backyard and enjoy the fresh mountain air.

*Wifi + dedicated workspace
*Kitchenette great for reheating and storing food
*Family-friendly w/ amenities catering to children
*Plenty of essentials
*Close to MSU and Downtown
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment resides in a secure residential neighborhood, conveniently located just 1.8 miles south of the Museum of the Rockies and MSU. It's surrounded by parks, walking trails, mature trees, manicured lawns, and families.

The home is 3 miles from downtown Bozeman, 14 miles from Bozeman Airport, 20 miles from Bridger Bowl ski area, 50 miles from Big Sky Resort, 80 miles from Gardiner (North Entrance to Yellowstone National Park), and 90 miles from West Yellowstone.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries. You're a walk or a bike ride
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Mountain Room, Queen bed, Workspace, Epic Location
description:
Looking for an affordable but central place to stay in Bozeman? Within 5 blocks, you can access Main Street, Peet's Hill, Bogert Park, Lindley Park, the library, and more!

This shared basement apartment offers you a private room while sharing the kitchen, bathroom, and living room with two other private rooms.

Early check-in available & a no-chore checkout!!
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located within walking distance, you'll find Bogert and Lindley Parks, where all the summer festivals come to life. Additionally, Pete's Hill and its extensive network of over 80 miles of trails are easily accessible. Bozeman Public Library, downtown with its array of shops, bars, and restaurants, as well as public transport options to Bridger Bowl and Big Sky, are all just a short stroll away.

name: Downtown Bozeman Studio Spot
description:
Centrally located in downtown Bozeman, MT. This studio space in our home is 10 minutes from the airport, 5 minutes from Montana State University and groceries are within walking distance. The beloved downtown Bozeman is right outside the door with shops and world class restaurants within a 5 minute walk.
This space is shared with born and raised locals who can tell you all the best secrets this valley has to offer. You have your own private space much like a hotel room with a private full bath.

name: Elegant 3Bdrm Stay | Mountain Views & Beach Access
description:
Pagoda Peaks is waiting to welcome you! This stunning 3-story home offers luxurious accommodations with breathtaking panoramic views of the Bridger Mountains. Perfect for families or couples, it features 3 bedrooms, 4 bathrooms, two fireplaces, and exquisite furnishings. The chef's kitchen, grand dining area, and multiple terraces provide ample space for relaxation and entertainment.

*Luxury amenities
*Outdoor seating & BBQ
*Laundry
*Private office
*Backs onto hiking/biking trail systems
neighborhood_overview:
The home is situated in a truly wonderful location. With breathtaking views of the Bridger Mountains and steps to Bozeman Beach, it offers the perfect blend of natural beauty and convenient access to outdoor activities, making it an ideal retreat for nature lovers, adventure seekers, and anyone wanting some rest and relaxation.

Pagoda Peaks is 2.5 miles from downtown Bozeman, 16 miles to Bridger Bowl Ski Area, 52 miles to Big Sky Resort, and 90 miles to Yellowstone National Park.

The area features endless hiking and mountain biking trails, blue-ribbon trout streams, and Nordic and Alpine Ski areas.

The popular MAP brewing company is just across the pond, and many restaurants and shops are nearby at the Cannery District and Downtown Bozeman.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry explori

description:
Kick back and relax in this calm and cozy condo offering a great combination of luxury, comfort, and breathtaking views in the heart of Bozeman. This immaculate space is ideal for any kind of traveler.

- Just 15 minutes from Bozeman Yellowstone Airport
- Only a 7 minute drive to Montana State University
- A quick 10 minute walk to downtown Bozeman
- Centrally located between 2 ski resorts. Bridger Bowl (17 miles away) and Big Sky Resort (51 miles away)

name: Downtown Chic Urban Abode
description: Located in downtown Bozeman this fully renovated condo is housed in a historical commercial building on Main Street. With an alley exit you will be within walking distance of your favorite restaurants, theaters, stores and coffee houses. neighborhood_overview: The walkability is amazing from the condo with restaurants, coffee houses, retail stores, libraries, museums, co-ops, theaters, cultural centers all within walking distance.
host_about:
Hi, 
Welcome to Bozeman where my husband and I have been in the hospitality industry for close to 40 years. We owned and operated a restaurant on Main Street and most recently host vacation rentals. It is truly our passion, and it is our goal to meet your expectations for your time in Bozeman. We know the area like the back of our hand and would be delighted to answer questions and guide you in the right direction:)
We look forward to hosting you in 
Montana’s Big Sky Country!

name: Bright, Cozy Cottage w/ Parking | Walk to Downtown
description:
Experience the best of Bozeman from this cozy sanctuary, perfectly situated in the heart of town. This charming cottage is well-equipped to make you feel right at home, nestled in a quiet residential neighborhood filled with trees and close to a park. Whether you're here to ski, fish, hike, bike, visit the university, work, or explore downtown, our prime location offers easy access to all the action while providing a smooth stay.

*Driveway parking
*Laundry
*Full kitchen
*Walk to local Co-Op
neighborhood_overview:
We are situated in one of the best locations in Bozeman! Nestled in a lovely walkable neighborhood, enjoy being 3 blocks away from Cooper Park. Enjoy the beautiful greenspace with mature trees, picnic tables, friendly dogs, and students playing frisbee. It's a great place for a stroll or a picnic.

Four blocks north, you'll reach the Bozeman Community Food Co-op where you can find local, organic produce and grocery staples, plus a fantastic hot bar, grab-and-go food options, fresh flowers, toiletries, and more.

You're a half-mile walk to Starbucks or Maven's Market, a gourmet cheese, sandwich, and gelato shop. Walk to downtown Bozeman where you’ll find cute coffee shops, great dining options, locally-owned boutiques, cool bars, and much more!

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellows
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Southbridge Cottage: Cozy and Modern Home (NEW)
description: This fabulous, single level, 3 bedroom, 2 bath house is great for everyone! The open floor plan combines the dining, kitchen, and living room with large windows and plenty of natural light. This cheerful home is located in south Bozeman. Montana State University is just 2 miles away!
neighborhood_overview:
The Southbridge subdivision in Bozeman, Montana, offers a charming and picturesque setting for short-term rental homes, nestled within the stunning natural beauty of the Gallatin Valley. Bozeman itself is a vibrant and thriving city renowned for its unique blend of outdoor adventure, cultural attractions, and small-town charm.

Southbridge is ideally situated just a short distance from downtown Bozeman, providing guests with convenient access to a plethora of dining, shopping, and entertainment options. The subdivision boasts well-maintained streets lined with beautiful homes, offering a tranquil retreat for visitors seeking relaxation and rejuvenation.

Nature enthusiasts will appreciate the abundance of outdoor recreational opportunities available in the surrounding area, including hiking, fishing, skiing, and more. The nearby Bridger Mountains and Gallatin National Forest offer endless opportunities for exploration and adventure, making Southbridge an ideal desti
host_about:
We love being outdoors.  We live to travel.  We believe riches come from experiences, not things. 
It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

name: 3-Bedroom Hideaway: Your Bozeman Adventure Awaits!
description:
Discover Bozeman from our central 3-bedroom retreat! Just blocks from Main St., parks, and so much more. Ideal for families, friends, or groups.

Normally we rent this apartment by the room but when you choose this listing you have the entire 3 bedroom basement apartment to yourself. Two queen sized beds and one full bed with a living room, dining room, full kitchen and bathroom.

Early check-in option, and leave the cleaning to us with our no-chore checkout!
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located within walking distance, you'll find Bogert and Lindley Parks, where all the summer festivals come to life. Additionally, Pete's Hill and its extensive network of over 80 miles of trails are easily accessible. Bozeman Public Library, downtown with its array of shops, bars, and restaurants, as well as public transport options to Bridger Bowl and Big Sky, are all just a short stroll away.

name: Fantastic Location | Free Breakfast
description:
Residence Inn Bozeman Downtown Hotel is the perfect setting for an extraordinary Rocky Mountain experience.

Just nearby you can:
✔ Admire Yellowstone’s dramatic canyons, alpine rivers, lush forests, hot springs and gushing geysers
✔ Ski with an unforgettable view
✔ Explore the history of computing, communications, artificial intelligence and robotics
at The American Computer & Robotics Museum
✔ Watch a show at Ellen Theatre
✔ Take a tour at the award winning distillery Bozeman Spirits
neighborhood_overview:
▶ Activities and Cultural Attractions
— Yellowstone National Park – 1 h 37 min drive
— Big Sky Ski Resort – 1h 9 min drive
— Bridger Bowl – 23 min drive
— Ellen Theatre – 3 min drive/ 14 min walk
— Glen Lake Rotary Park – 6 min drive
— Gallatin Valley Mall – 10 min drive
— Palisade Falls – 45 min drive
— Bozeman Hot Springs – 19 min drive

▶ Places to eat and drink
— SAPPHIRE BAR & RESTAURANT – at the hotel
— Plonk – 3 min drive/ 13 min walk
— Montana Ale Works – 1min drive/ 3 min walk
— Blackbird Kitchen – 2 min drive/ 11 min walk
— Copper Whiskey Bar & Grill – 3min drive/12 min walk
— Ted's Montana Grill – 4 min drive/ 16 min walk
— Jam! – 3 min drive/ 15 min walk
— Seven Sushi – 5 min drive/ 30 min walk

▶ Places to visit
— Museum of the Rockies – 8 min drive
— American Computer and Robotics Museum – 8 min drive
— Gallatin

We look forward to hosting you. Julie and Scott

name: Alpine Cottage
description: New for 2024! Fast WiFi. Keyless self check-in.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Bright & Cozy 1Bdrm Loft | Walk to MSU & Downtown
description:
Experience the best of Bozeman in our cozy, beautifully decorated 1 bedroom loft. Perfect for MSU parents, conference attendees, or anyone exploring the area, this retreat is conveniently located on Bozeman’s southside in a lovely, green neighborhood. Walk to Montana State University, downtown, and numerous parks and trails, then return to the loft to unwind in comfort. This home perfectly blends convenience and charm.

*Full kitchen
*Well stocked
*Laundry in unit
*Clean & bright
neighborhood_overview:
The loft sits above a garage in the Capitol Hill Subdivision, Bozeman's oldest historic neighborhood near the MSU campus. Main Street is less than a mile away, with excellent coffee shops and restaurants just blocks from home. Built in 1939, the house was renovated in 2016, including the loft where you're staying. The lush, pedestrian-friendly area offers a serene retreat with beautiful historic homes throughout the neighborhood.

The stay is conveniently located only 13 miles from Bozeman’s Yellowstone International Airport. Additionally, Bridger Bowl Ski Area and Crosscut Cross-Country Ski Area are a short 17-mile drive away, with Big Sky Resort just 43 miles from your doorstep. Explore the stunning North Entrance of Yellowstone, an easy 80-mile scenic drive from the property.

In addition to hiking, biking, and trail running accessible from town, you can enjoy fishing on the nearby East Gallatin and main Gallatin Rivers, horseback riding, rafting, tours of Yellow
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Bozeman Homebase - 3 Bed, 2 Bath
description: Your perfect Bozeman homebase: minutes from downtown, MSU, and local attractions. Ideal for year-round adventures - 30 minutes to Bridgerowl Ski Area, 1 hour to Big Sky. Nestled on a quiet street with a private, fenced backyard featuring a 4-person sauna. Cozy up by the fireplace on cool evenings. This charming home offers the perfect blend of serenity and accessibility, whether you're here for winter sports, summer hiking, or a peaceful getaway. Your ultimate Bozeman experience starts here.
host_about:
I'm a born and raised Montanan. I've done some traveling around the world and I just couldn't leave "The Last Best Place". I am a designer at A&E Design, a local Architecture and Design Firm. 

I live in the main house of the property with my black lab mix 'River'.  We spend a lot of our time outside on the river, slopes, hunting, camping, or hanging out in Historic Downtown Bozeman. 

We look forward to accommodating you and your adventure to this great town.

name: Fantastic Location | Free Breakfast
description:
Residence Inn Bozeman Downtown Hotel is the perfect setting for an extraordinary Rocky Mountain experience.

Just nearby you can:
✔ Admire Yellowstone’s dramatic canyons, alpine rivers, lush forests, hot springs and gushing geysers
✔ Ski with an unforgettable view
✔ Explore the history of computing, communications, artificial intelligence and robotics
at The American Computer & Robotics Museum
✔ Watch a show at Ellen Theatre
✔ Take a tour at the award winning distillery Bozeman Spirits

▶ Activities and Cultural Attractions
— Yellowstone National Park – 1 h 37 min drive
— Big Sky Ski Resort – 1h 9 min drive
— Bridger Bowl – 23 min drive
— Ellen Theatre – 3 min drive/ 14 min walk
— Glen Lake Rotary Park – 6 min drive
— Gallatin Valley Mall – 10 min drive
— Palisade Falls – 45 min drive
— Bozeman Hot Springs – 19 min drive

▶ Places to eat and drink

— Plonk – 3 min drive/ 13 min walk

— Blackbird Kitchen – 2 min drive/ 11 min walk
— Copper Whiskey Bar & Grill – 3min drive/12 min walk
— Ted's Montana Grill – 4 min drive/ 16 min walk
— Jam! – 3 min drive/ 15 min walk
— Seven Sushi – 5 min drive/ 30 min walk

▶ Places to visit
— Museum of the Rockies – 8 min drive
— American Computer and Robotics Museum – 8 min drive
— Gallatin

name: Cozy Historic Hideaway in Downtown Bozeman
description: Nestled in the basement of a charming historic property, this cozy 850 sq ft, two-bedroom, one-bathroom unit offers a private retreat in downtown Bozeman. With a blend of old-world charm and modern updates, the unit features in-unit laundry and amenities ideal for monthly stays. Just a block from Historic Main Street and near parks and trails, this space provides easy access to all Bozeman has to offer, making it perfect for those looking to embrace the vibrant downtown lifestyle.
host_about:
I'm a Bozeman native who lives in Austin with my wife, four daughters and our goldendoodle, Burrbon. We've lived in Chicago, Baltimore, and perhaps one day we'll be back in Montana. Until then, we love getting up there to visit when we can. We love the Sweet Pea festival and skiing Bridger and Big Sky. 

We love travel, adventure and creating memories together as a family.

name: Cinnabar Suite - Mountain Views
description: The Cinnabar Suite is a stylish 1-BR, 1.5-BA apartment in the heart of Bozeman, offering incredible Bridger Mountain views from the 3rd floor. It features a spacious king-size bedroom, high-speed WiFi, a fully equipped kitchen, in-unit laundry, and a cozy living area. A covered parking space adds convenience, while its central location makes exploring downtown Bozeman’s restaurants, shops, and the surrounding natural beauty easy. The Cinnabar Suite is perfect for both relaxation and adventure.
host_about:
We love being outdoors.  We live to travel.  We believe riches come from experiences, not things. 
It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

name: Unmatched Privacy & Luxury for the Entire Family
description: **SOFT OPENING:** Enjoy 50% off stays before 04/30/25 at this exquisitely restored 1881 Vintage Estate in Downtown Bozeman. Perfect for groups, this high-end offering consists of three luxurious, private residences with everything needed for a relaxing, sophisticated stay. Just a block from Main Street, you’ll be steps away from Bozeman’s top eateries, shopping, galleries, and vibrant nightlife.
neighborhood_overview:
A hot spot for investment and opportunity, Bozeman has attracted the nation’s eye. This idyllic town is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter the time of year. Located in the most exclusive location in Downtown Bozeman, VE is exclusivity and privacy in the center of the city. The property is in the central business district offering convenient access to restaurants, shops, and nightlife. Within six blocks of VE, you’ll find numerous eateries and boutique shops, right within walking distance. The area offers dining options like Little Star Diner, a farm-to-table restaurant just a block away, known for locally sourced dishes. A short walk further brings you to Main Street where Blackbird Kitchen serves up handcrafted pizzas and Italian-inspired cuisine. Outside of restaurants, you’ll also find a nearby French bakery and cafe, Vienne, and dessert options such as La Chatelaine Chocolat Co.

Beyond the cityscape, in the warmer months you

name: Comfy Modern Industrial Condo

Modern, industrial designed flat/1-bedroom condo. Great location with easy access to downtown Bozeman, Big Sky and Bridger Bowl. King size bed in the bedroom and a queen blow up mattress for kids and guests.
